I am genuinely heartbroken to have to review a Halo game negatively for the first time in my life. TL;DR at the EndAs a precursor, I am not new to the series, I did not start at Halo 4, nor did I purchase this as my first game. This may very well be the reason I disliked this game, my expectations just might be too high. That being said, being disappointed in a game when you are comparing it to its counterparts from ten years ago is.... sad. Personally, I enjoyed Halo for its rich lore, it really felt like there were alien civilisations bearing down on you, the games did an excellent job of bringing that lore to life, and if you wanted to expand upon it you could do as I did, and read the novels. This Halo feels like a shell, it has the aliens and the brutes and all that sure, but it doesn't feel like they are there. They are mindless NPCs with a few programmed lines, and that's how they feel. Lifeless, cold, empty, just bullet fodder. A point I will frequently bring up in this review is comparisons between this game and Just Cause 3, or Farcry 5. If you have played either of these games, you will be hard pressed in finding a difference between the generic human NPCs, and the multiple alien races of this game. A second point I would like to address is the length. It took me about 16 hours to complete everything in the game. Every FOB, every squad rescue, every propaganda tower, all spartan cores, cosmetic upgrades, and every outpost. I paid $80 (CAD) for a 16 hour long game. I paid a similar price for Tom Clancys Ghost Recon and I've been playing it for 40 hours, hell I haven't even beaten the main campaign in it yet. This game simply isn't long enough to justify the price. This is the third time 343 has bungled this, and enough is enough.A third point is the ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô?content. I am infuriated at how little is actually in this game. The short playtime, lack of lore, and ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• NPCs could be justified if there was reasonable content. Spoiler alert: there isn't. The story is bland, full of copy paste sections where you are doing the same thing over and over again. Sections in which you need to grab power seeds for a door for some reason that exist purely to pad the runtime, and meager boss fights that are difficult to distinguish between. (I will admit though, the two boss fights I did enjoy were the ones against the installation monitor, because I had to aim for specific parts of the body rather than ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô?grenade spam). At the end of the day, once you get over your Halo fanboyism the game is just ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô?boring and plain. It genuinely tears me apart to have not enjoyed a Halo game you cannot even begin to understand. Fourth is probably the weakest argument, Graphical errors. I understand these will be patched out, but delaying the release of a game for a year and there still being significant game breaking errors is just scummy.In conclusion, as with all of the modern Halo games, 3 steps forward, 43 back. I tried so so so so so hard to enjoy this game, but the bland story, lack of lore, awful enemies, bad guns, and generally uninspired game play was just too much for me. Buy the game if you want, I don't give a ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•, but just know what you're getting into. This game had some really cool features, don't get me wrong, and the open world aspect would have been incredible if not for it following the mold of Farcry 5 and Just Cause 3 to the Tee.

I totally recommend this game for anyone who likes good and rich story telling. I've never been into pixel kind of games, i've always been the kind of gamer which plays games like csgo or league of legends, but this game took me to another level and the story is captivating. It makes me sad that this kind of game will only be played by few while games like anthem will still be played by million. Own feelings:This title stole my heart when it appeared on PS4, unfortunately, without a console, I had to be content with watching YouTube videos, but my dream came true on the day of the release of this game on PC.Game description:It is a game that captivates with its story, its main character, whose path from her youth is not easy, decides to change her fate. The game is incredibly addictive, we have many styles of play, we can enter the opponents wreaking havoc or invisibly eliminate all of them in turn. Machines that were a problem, we can subjugate them and order them to fight on our side, which gives a huge range of possibilities.My opinion:I think that the game is great, addictive from the very first minutes I didn't feel like skipping any dialogues despite knowing the whole game. As for the game transferred from the console, the optimization is very good. I do not have a first class computer, it is already several years old, although almost everything on the lowest (medium) settings works and looks satisfactory.

A fun game with a good storyline, but not for everyone. This is a game, in my opinion, intended for people who are not bothered by frequent sneaking and often annoying patterns that need to be overcome. Apparently, we are moving not a heroine who becomes a superhero in a crisis, but a girl who is afraid and not always able to defeat her opponent. If anyone wants to see and play this game, I recommend the easiest difficulty level, which should be pleasant in the implementation of the presented story, I'm not a fan of games in which you have to sneak a lot and do many things quietly, so the average difficulty level is for bothersome me. But in conclusion, I recommend it even because of the plot itself and showing the hero as a really fragile girl who does not become invincible after the first events, but shows this helplessness.

Strong lord, but he doesnt have any unique and interesting mechanics, like newer FLC lords.

As a lord Tiktaqto is great bc he transforms his flying armies in to literal bombers. But as a unit he is bad, realy realy bad, especialy for the lizardmen who are known for strong lords and heroes and strong mounts for the weak lords and heroes, Tiktaqto is neither.

I didnt play all the clan I have, but this clan is my favourite at the moment.This is the only clan that can raly support its teamates by cooking food which gives a wide variety of buffs. Not only that, they can easly befriend neutral factions, but I tend to befriend only giants, the kobolds are useless and the alves are hard to befriend.With this clan I can win however I want. With battle oriented food buffs and giant population I can win by killing everyone.A lot of money and with food buffs make lore and trade victories so much easier. And each time I cook something I get a bit of fame, so fame victory is also possible. And did I say that all the food buffs work on teamates so it is much easier for all the team to win in their own way, so even if someone will fail,the others are boosted to heaven with food. Yea, squirrls.

Great game overall, didnt play an rts like this for a long time.The story mode is...Ok, nothing special, teaches a little how to play the ftp clans, and a few mechanics, which is nice,if it also tought about the relics and about all the victory types, it could have been better. The story itself is again, ok, nothing special but not that bad either.Also, all the ftp clan are as unique as the dlc clan, thats not something all companies do.

One of the best dlcs im my opinion.Grom is a fat (in all meanings of this word) chariat lord, who cooks and gives buffs not only to himself, but also for his entire army. Some buffs make immortal goblins, and some buffs make the enemy units regret not bringing shields. Also Grom buffs goblins better than Skarsnik making them a late game infantry. The units are as great as Grom himself, stone trolls who flatten anything that have, or doesnt have armor. The river trolls are so beatifull that enemies straight up refuse hitting them. The same goes fir the new river troll hag unit who wields the lore of death, which is nice, and throws up on enemies like Thrrog. Also there are different types of snotlings on wood cars, they are chariots, rly good chariots.And of course there are the idols, giant stone monsters who bring death and will of Gork and Mork and the battlefield. They also buff leadership,nice.Eltharion is... Boring,dont rly like him or his new units, nothing special rly. Maybe only the arcane phoenix is nice, but other than that.... Tha lion chariot also good,but nothing special.

Throt is a great and fantastic lords who offers an absolutly unique gameplay for the skaven race.Monsters, he buffs them as much as Ikit buffs weapon teams, and not only that, he comes with a new hero who makes the unkillable monsters of clan moulder even harder to kill. Sadly,the monsters in this dlc arnt that great, the dogs are good only at the start of the game, mutant rat ogre is weak, does almost no damge and dies quickly, even normal rat ogres benefited me more than this. The brood horrors are nice, not only as a unit but also as a mount. Also there is Ghoritch, he is nice,but he is weaker than the other legendery heroes at the moment.Sisters of Twighlight are a flying eagle bolt thrower, with poison and armor sundering. Thay can even summon a bird or a dragon. Their unique mechanic is actualy fun now. They can forge new unique and powerful items, or upgrade their armies. That nice.The new units are zoats, dragon ogres but with magic, white stags, good replacement to the wild riders, who were utter crap. Also there are some kind of new elven unit I never used, dint even remember their name. Also there is new wizard lord, dont realy like them, they ride eagles while there are lords who ride dragons and a giant tree. Also a new legendery hero to almost all the wood elves, great caster, not as greast as Lord Kroak, but she is good.
Tone of the two best vampire lords, qnd the wife of the second best vampire lord.Buffs vampire heroes making them a one man army, when tehy are already pretty powerful wizards.

So after almost a year passed since i'v bought this game, 26 hours of gameplay & most of the game's side quests completed. This is one of the most boring games i have ever played.The story & voice acting is what this game excels at, every character is unique in it's own way and the story is some what interesting. Gameplay & combat are plain simple. Basic guns like the heavy machine gun. shotgun, sniper rifle, pistol & few tech weapons which i'v put aside after a few fights. companion abilities are just a headache after a few times due a repetition of the only cinematic for their attack. Character abilities are useless in my opinion, i didn't care about the character & companions leveling up.Missions & side quests are all the same, kill this + talk with the npc = get xp and money, rinse and repeat.The locations are kind of unique, and by that i mean they all have a different color pallet like one planet is purple, and the other is orange, and the next is grey orange. nothing special. further more, the overall colors and contrast of the game just gave me headache and it makes the environment look weird and unpleasent.overall, a waste of time, feels like an extended demo version of what meant to be a full game.

Adequate at best.If you want a Knights of the Old Republic style RPG game THIS IS NOT IT. This is a Tomb Raider game wearing stormtrooper armour. If you like Tomb Raider you are in for a treat. If you are a Star Wars RPG fan this is about as Star Wars as a Euro Truck simulator with a Darth Vader shaped air freshener. Good:It was stable, I didn‚Äôt see the problem others have seen; my rig never struggles though.OKIt is pretty, which matters for a good ten minutes, then the lack of anything to say starts to wear.BadIt occasionally turns into a corridor shooter (lightsabre only for you). Mostly it is corridor platform jumper, die/ repeat the jump grind. At these points using mouse and keyboard may not be the best, I doubt this is why this game sucks, but it is why this is not the Star Wars game I was looking for.As a big Star Wars fan I really want to like this game; it is not dreadful but really not that good. I am not certain I will be bothered finishing it, so it cannot do better than a solid 4/10.
Simple, not brilliant but a good idea well executed. Worth a go.

2020 UpdateThe first review comments below are mostly still true. Death can be very random and seem unfair and the game is still unpolished. The trick to having fun with the game is realising, especially if you are new, that dying and respawning is part of the game. The game is still 2lb of poo in a 1lb bag but bizarrely good fun.----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------Excellent game, I really really want to like this game but the amateurish development has spoiled by some bad game balancing.To quote Rock Paper Shotgun  "7 Days To Die looks genuinely impressive, and I can‚Äôt see this not making a huge impact when it arrives." A quote from May 2013, still true.The game is a slighty Minecrafty zombie RPG. Start the game - grind grind grind - you get infected - you die.Birds attack you from the rear - you get infected - you die.(Unless you find honey or are a week in and can maybe craft antibiotics by finding ten rare drops. They are rare.Day 1, Oh look, there is a wolf. You have a stick and a flaming torch to defend yourself but its not afraid of fire. It attacks you , you die.If you dont want to get infected wear armour- you overheat - you die.Saying that standing stationary naked except for a cowboy hat and white trousers in a dark room at 2am chain chugging cold drinks means you overheat. And die.You can respawn but unless I have done something stupid i dont want the game to kill me, if I want unfair I'll play a game with hackers. The game features are clearly incomplete.The user interface is not finished.The game world and textures are not important but not finished.Game balancing ruins the game."It's still in alpha" you say. Two words - "Elite Dangerous". Its a started as a small team kickstarter, but came out on time, fairly popular, started limited but playable, now playable. Development is a good answer for the first 3 years, that was nearly 3 years ago.  A professional company would have finished this by now. Your marketing should be "we have sold a lot of copies and made a lot of money but not made a game yet". Do not buy until it publishes for real, by which time someone else will have played this for a few months and then published a similar game with the lessons learned from this one.

I really want to like this game but really dont.Batle start. The level is 4 out of skulls hard, not suicidal hard - lets go with the game advice and pick 4 assualt mechs with the most firepower you have.As the game suggests - more firepower is reccommended.Targets appear on the radar. Mechs can indirect fire with some weaker weapons but anything you sensor locks moves immediately.You get a message - their reinforcements are on the way. Their reinforcements all have long range indirect fire. They all start firing before you can effectively engage their first units. Its 8 against 4 now, in a battle 6vs 4 is normally bad odds. You can still "win" but it is now an attrition slog, about as much fun as the Somme. The difficult level bugs andthe immediate reinforcements were supposed to be fixed. Haha.Summary of the RPG element.Blah blah blah. I'm a princess, the bad people are bad.Click 1, 2 or 3. Blah blah blah that makes no difference to the game at all, blah blah bad art blah blah.¬£5 at best, and I think you will find a better game to spend that on too.

Beautiful game with a touching story. After playing Hollow Knight this feels very forgiving when it comes to boss fights which means the game is focused more on the platforming, puzzles and mainly the story. Side quests are not a burden and if you enjoy exploring every corner of the game then you won't even notice how you accomplish them. All in all, i would highly suggest this game to everyone who loves these type of games.

i don't really give reviews, but i feel like i had to say something about this game. At first i hesitated to buy this game, but i sure glad i did. The fighting and movement is super smooth, there is a story that doesn't end before you are done with stages, there is always something new to find and discover. Keeping in mind that this is the Patch v1.0 , this is an amazing start.

i got this a while back and i was really surprised to see the big change in the game. By that i mean it felt like the game changed 100% from one to another. Now i am not sure if i like the new one or the old version more, either way i am just waiting for the game to be fully released with the full story and all its content. Until then, if you are thinking about buying the game right now,then do it - the price is lower - the game will be fully released shortly and if you are like me who likes to play games without looking too much as to what other people have to say then i wish you a steady road ahead.

even though i don't have hundreds of hours of gameplay,i can say that i love this game so much,it's has pretty graphics,a great combat system and overall it gives an amazing gaming experience,i can honestly say that the money is well spent.There are some bugs like when you die your body jumps,or somethimes your horse  gets stuck in the ground,but other than that,the game is amazing!

To be honest,i really expected a lot from this game and although the graphics are nice,it's now what i was expecting. Sure the game looks nice,the voices are smooth and the atmosphere is emersing,but what bugged me a lot was the the combat system,it's pretty much all the same,you have light and heavy attack,you attack the bad guy with few strikes and you dash away and well you have to just repeat the same thing over and over,it's very repeatitive and that i was i really hate about this game. It feels like the devs spent their time mostly on the atmosphere and the "feel" of the game,rather that trying to make some kind of interesting aproach towards the combat system. I am not saying the game is terrible,it's just not perfect and not for everyone :) thought i did ask to get my money back.
Besides the many buttons you need to keep smashing i love this game

Lost Ark has everything you would expect from a normal MMO, PvE with raids, dungeons and questing.   PvP with instanced based arenas and open world fights and crafting, housing and more.  This isn‚Äôt an MMO that lacks content, collectables are things to do at launch.  Often times Lost Ark feels like there‚Äôs too much to do and you can easily get overwhelmed.The TLDR about Lost Ark that I found is it‚Äôs a potato chip game.  Meant to be played, like eating a snack.  Not eating an entire bag of chips expecting to be full and satisfied but bit by bit enjoying the journey.  But let‚Äôs move on and cover some of the basics about the game.Lost ark features 5 classes with 15 subclasses each with their own unique skills and playstyle. (I think the first trailer has each class broken down, I‚Äôd cut that up otherwise they have trailers 9 seconds for each:Warrior, heavy melee focused, and one could argue the meatheads of Lost ArkMartial Artist another melee focused hand to hand combat styleGunner as you can guess, range with weaponsMage, typical magic ranged caster from any other RPGAnd Assassin which are your quick and demonic rogue melee typesThe visuals are what people notice first about Lost Ark, the top-down isometric view.  This feels like Diablo and Divinity Original Sin 2 had a baby both in terms of camera position and partly gameplay.In Lost Ark you‚Äôll mainly use point and click for movement and targeting and it takes a bit to get use to. You‚Äôll also have many hotkeys for items, consumables, mounts and so on which will feel familiar to World of Warcraft type MMOs.  I would say if the top-down view and controls are jarring for you, don‚Äôt quit the game entirely as it takes time to adapt but this isn‚Äôt for everyoneYou start out your character like any other MMO with a customizable character creator, picking your class and then an introduction tutorial.  The first thing I didn‚Äôt care for in Lost Ark was gender locked classes, which the developers said later they would change.  The character creator didn‚Äôt feel that special or unique, offering very little that was new or stood out.  The tutorial, however, was very impressive giving you a solid course in combat and holding your hand making you understand the core components of the games fundamentals.Speaking of the combat, before I played Lost Ark, I felt from watching videos and streams this was a button masher with very little skill, until I played it.  I realized very quickly that wasn‚Äôt the case when I encountered good players in both PvE and PvP. Positioning, timing, rotations, consumables, understanding crowd control, interrupts and the list goes on and on.Unlike your traditional tab target MMOs you won‚Äôt have to manage 30+ abilities with 2-minute-long cooldowns.  The combat feels much more responsive and active with very little need to ‚Äúauto attack‚Ä?or wait your major ability to come off cool down.The character builds blend a semi traditional skill tree with passive you can take as you increase the skill points of an ability.  You‚Äôll get 3 options at each stage with 3 stage total, giving you some customization in your build. But truthfully, most meta builds have been established and exported from the Korea server, so you have little flexibility in skills and spec if you want to be any good at the game.Speaking of not being good at the game, At first, I was your typical button masher.  Not reading my skills, auto attacking mostly, and having trouble with the most basic of dungeons.  I went back to the drawing board started looking at online resource for builds and working on a rotation.  I also used the in-game interface to setup multi spec builds, one for AoE massive fights, one for bosses and single target.Then it became clear like other MMOs, the combat is like a dance.  Go in for the attack, do a combination of 3 or so abilities and move out and repeat.  Far from button mashing, you have to wait for key moments to time your ultimate and chain combination attacks or interrupting a boss within a split second for a clutch victory.This is one of the core strengths of the game, it‚Äôs combat.  There‚Äôs so much nuance to the combat it could take you a lifetime to master.  Not to mention just as soon as you get a hang of one subclass, there‚Äôs 14 more to go, giving you endless amounts of replay.Back to my original point about the tutorial and combat, you‚Äôll complete this section and start your journey that is nearly entirely linear at the start of the game.  You move from bread crumb to bread crumb, questing relentlessly and at certain intervals, the game teaches you new mechanics, systems, and currencies.This is a catch 22 for me.  One side, I love the hand holding and making sure you know where to go and what to do, on the other hand I felt I pigeonholed into doing questing for hours on end when all I wanted to do was experience PvP and group PvE.Regarding the story which I will not spoil, it‚Äôs quite impressive. Smilegate does an incredible job at cutscenes, building up of the main bad guy and epic fights with massive over the top graphical conclusions.  Sometimes it felt like Dragon Ball Z meets Lord of the Rings.  There are incredible parts of the games initially story where I thought the quality and scope were that of a single player RPG.  But you‚Äôre hit with major snags and slow points and so you get a roller coaster effect of excitement and boredom.Even though there are slow points, I‚Äôd honestly recommend the game to anyone who enjoys typical RPG stories.  But ultimately, I truly missed the freedom, exploration and choices of other games like Elder Scrolls Online or Star Wars the Old Republic which allowed you to explore at your own pace AND do activates outside of questing for hours. (SWTOR clips in here and ESO)But don‚Äôt worry, it gets better, much better.Once you reach level 26 and complete some of basic story elements you can compete in PvP instanced based combat 3v3 arenas or team elimination.  And this is where the game truly shines. It‚Äôs a true competitive environment.  Meaning, even at level 26, you get access to all the skills that other players have, and gear isn‚Äôt a factor.  Let me say that again, there isn‚Äôt any gear, power level, gear cap, nothing that effects your performance other than your ability and competence.This feels like the potential for e sport quality PvP though it‚Äôs not going to be for everyone.  The PvP in Lost Ark centers around constant crowd control, movement, angles, and geometry.  You have no real ‚Äúheal‚Ä?per say, only shields.  Thus, each teammate will need to peel, defend, and help their team otherwise you‚Äôll get dunked on.  I got sucked into PvP at level 26.  In fact, I pretty much stopped what I was doing because I like PvPso much that I couldn‚Äôt get enough of it.   Typically, I was the weak link on my team, but I didn‚Äôt care.  I was learning, competing, and having fun.  Moreover, I didn‚Äôt have to spend 1,000 hours to farm gear, the ques were instanced, the game has such a robust population you never fought the same person twice.  Need I go on?

The Forest starts off like the first episode of Lost, where you crash-land on an airplane in an uncharted setting with no technology. I have to admit, for as brief a cinematic as it was, the plane crash is a thrill and reminiscent of how Bioshock kicked off. Once you come to, you and your friends have free reign to navigate the island and do everything it takes to survive. You‚Äôll immediately find this is easier said than done, as you encounter your first batch of other humans.The enemies in The Forest are tribal warriors that will demolish you if you‚Äôre not careful. They vary from intelligent survivalists to frantic savages, to abhorrent monstrosities. Other than the ax you are given from the plane, you can also craft spears for fast attacks, bows for enemies far away, and even set your foes ablaze with a combination of your lighter and a can of hairspray. Enemies tend to fight in packs, so it‚Äôs paramount that you and your friends work together to dispatch them.The main attraction of The Forest is ironically not the areas within the trees but instead, the massive caves spread across the island. You‚Äôll find key items in these dark, expansive areas, like flashlights, chainsaws, and climbing tools for cragged rock. Past this, you‚Äôll need to manage your hunger, thirst, and body temperature. Sometimes the best food available is the tribal warrior you just killed, making cannibalism seem like a normality for survival. Morality is truly out the window in this game.For sanctuary, you can build a nice shelter with the resources scattered about your surroundings. Chopping down trees feels great, watching them fall with great physics and a subtle creaking sound as it plummets to the ground. Once your housing is built, you can save your progress. Unfortunately, I did encounter a universal crash and lost 30+ minutes of progress at one point, so an autosave feature upon entering/exiting caves would be welcome instead of the ear-splitting bats.In the survival game landscape, I‚Äôd still put The Forest very high on the list of quality, as the game clearly benefitted from its long development time and player input. It‚Äôs always great to see a game emerge from Early Access and earn Overwhelmingly Positive reviews on Steam. If you have a group to play with, it‚Äôs easy to recommend The Forest at this point, even several years after its initial popularity, as it‚Äôs been a blast for me so far!

This is why you should play Terraria in 2022If you haven‚Äôt already dug deep into Terraria, 2022 is the perfect time to start.Thanks to more than a decade of constant development, Terraria has become an icon of online gaming. The open-world game has a polished gameplay loop around exploring, crafting, and challenging difficult boss fights. All of that takes place in a randomly-generated world that changes as the game progresses.If you‚Äôre interested in picking up Terraria in 2022, here‚Äôs everything you should know.What is Terraria?Terraria is a procedurally-generated sandbox game built around exploration and combat. Players start with very basic tools and weapons with the goal of improving their strength to take on new areas. Terraria features a very in-depth biome system, which includes designated evil zones including a hell layer. Unlike similar games, Terraria features dozens of boss fights meant to challenge the player and gate progression.A major selling point of the game is its massive amount of content. From its release in 2011 to 2022, Terraria has gone through over a decade of content additions and adjustments. There are dozens of ways to improve characters and thousands of items to collect and craft.If the single-player content ever gets boring, Terraria fans can host online worlds to team up with friends and take on the world together.

Should I play Rainbow Six Siege if I like military simulators? For better or worse, the Tom Clancy vibe is mostly gone from Rainbow Six Siege. It‚Äôs less dark and gritty and more vibrant and colorful, mostly for gameplay purposes. Siege is a first-person shooter at heart, the tactics and gadgets augment the shooter mechanics. If you‚Äôre looking for a game like Squad or ARMA, Siege likely isn‚Äôt for you. It was always less of what you wanted in a game from the beginning and is rapidly becoming less of what you want over time. Should I play Rainbow Six Siege if I like military simulators and have played before?Yes! At its core, Siege is a great game, even if it isn‚Äôt bang-on the Tom Clancy branding. If you‚Äôre a fan of military simulators, Siege is likely going to be a little fast-paced for your liking, but if you‚Äôve played before you know what you‚Äôre getting into.There are still tons of tactics and gadgets to immerse yourself in ‚Ä?even if the darkness and grittiness that was there from the original games wasn‚Äôt all the way there at launch, and is rapidly fading. Should I play Rainbow Six Siege if I like first-person shooters and am new to the game?It‚Äôs hard to say yes here. Ultimately, Siege is a great experience but is not friendly to new or inconsistent players. There are massive maps, tons of gadgets, and dozens of unique interactions between the operators that aren‚Äôt explained well in supplementary content from Ubisoft. New players are going to have dozens of hours of headaches before they feel like they really understand what‚Äôs going on. The players that have been playing Siege have been playing for upwards of seven years. That‚Äôs a lot of experience and work to try and bypass. It is unforgiving, and you‚Äôre forced to learn quick or be very bored with the game. It‚Äôs impossible to recommend R6 to any new player that doesn‚Äôt have a lot of patience and a lot of spare time. If you‚Äôre a solo player it‚Äôs impossible. With friends it‚Äôs possible, but you‚Äôll arguably have more fun in another game.

Apex wrapped 2021 as an extremely confident battle royale, and at time of writing it feels like the game's legends and weapons are superbly balanced. Some legends are weaker than others, but none are straight-up unplayable (with the possible exception of Crypto), and Respawn has been working to make characters with low pick-rates like Rampart and Wattson more fun to play.Apex has settled into a strong rhythm with its updates, too. Every three months brings a new season, and with it a new character and new weapon to lend each season a distinct feel. At the end of each year we get a new map, though even existing maps will get smaller updates at a rate of one per season. Each half-season "split" will usually come with a themed event that pairs new cosmetics with a "town takeover" map change or, as of season 9, a new arena for Arenas. There have been quiet months in the last year, sure but you're never far out from something new. The game's latest season, Escape, closed out the year with a stunning new map and the return of a beloved Titanfall 2 baddie, and has kept up the pace with festive train minigames and nautical themed events.And yet, it's not all perfect in paradise. While Escape has largely avoided the rampant server issues of the season prior, a host of smaller issues have been cropping up over the season, with several significant bugs arriving with the last patch. The Rampage and Sentinel were temporarily removed last week after their charge mechanics became bugged and prone to exploit. Bangalore's newest MIL-SPEC skin was also removed after crashing the game during hero selection, and recent collection events have occasionally failed to pay out their rewards. Loving Apex is sometimes painful. The game's roots in the Source engine are what gives it a near-limitless bag of mobility tricks, but that dated tech is also what leaves it feeling constantly on the verge of breakdown. Apex may never feel as polished as competitors like Fortnite and Overwatch. But when it's working right, it's a joy to behold.

Team Fortress 2 is a Multiplayer First-person Shooter game developed and published by Valve Corporation. It is the sequel to 1996‚Äôs Team Fortress mod for Quake and the 1999 remake, Team Fortress Classic. The game was released in October 2007 for Windows and Xbox 360 as part of the Orange Box, and was ported to the PlayStation 3 in December 2007.It was released as a standalone game for Windows in April 2008, and was updated to support Mac OS X. Linux in June 2010 and in February 2013. It is distributed online through Valve‚Äôs digital retailer Steam, with Electronic Arts managing the retail and console versions.I first saw this game when my brother played it in 2013. My favorite game ever. Character design is unique, creative, funny and so much more! Best community I‚Äôve ever seen! Helpful, friendly and funny people. A guy spent 30 minutes teaching me how to solve a puzzle, we‚Äôve been friends ever since. and so much more! I played this game for 1238 hours and I still love it and will always do.9 different characters: 3 attackers, 3 defenders and 3 supports. Although this time sadly the game has been besieged by bots that are using aim assist, but we have got a small update to fight against bots.After playing around 10 maps I hardly encountered like 2-3 bots. And the team always kicks it. Community servers have zero bots. You can still have a lot of fun in it. Try Community Server. The game is free! Go try it. It‚Äôs worth it.Main warnings there are a lot of hackers plaguing the game right now, because TF2 is unfortunately at the bottom of Valve‚Äôs priority list. It‚Äôs pretty easy to get rid of them by calling a vote to kick them, but it‚Äôs still annoying.the learning curve of TF2 is pretty intense. At first, you might think you‚Äôre garbage at the game. Trust me, everyone thinks that they are garbage at first. TF2 is a game that takes a long time to master, and the tutorials aren‚Äôt very helpful. If you want to train before entering an actual match, I would highly recommend training with bots, as it gives you the general idea of ‚Äã‚Äãthe gameplay.

Forza Horizon 5 is the product of a developer who has absolutely mastered their craft.Every aspect of this game has been improved on from its predecessors. Graphics, handling, map size, customizations, car variety and more.Not only have they rehauled the graphics making it look even more impressive and gorgeous than ever before but the maps drastic size is something to really behold. You‚Äôre able to race in the dry desert, to ruins in the lost jungle, to the snowy mountains, to the beautiful coast and beaches and then all the way to an erupting volcano. They have you racing through hurricanes, sand storms, going through rivers and waterfalls. I mean, the experiences this game has are endless. Bomb soundtrack, a more casual than competitive multiplayer, and car tuning (as always) oh and don‚Äôt forget anime liveries, tons and tons of anime liveries XD. All of these things will keep the longevity of this game alive for a while. The only small issue I have is they took away body kits that other cars had in the previous titles. They still have them for some cars but cars that had them before don‚Äôt have them this time. I‚Äôve been playing racing games for over 25 years and this is hands down one of the best simcade racers I have ever played. Completely stunning in every aspect. 10/10!!

This game has everything you could ever want.1. Guns - A huge selection of guns. Beam rifles, assault rifles, pirate cannons, plasma arc shotguns, you name it.2. Story - An incredible story. From start to finish, the story in Warframe is incredible and definitely worth your time.3. Space Ninja - You can double jump, slide, dash, and do just about anything a space ninja could ever want.4. Farm - You can farm up resources or mastery level and sink in so many hours into this game that you'll wonder where they all went. Then you'll look at your arsenal and be like "f*** yeah, I got all this cool s***".5. Trading - Do you need a mod for your weapon? Do you want a new warframe that rocks? You can trade using platinum (in game currency) and you can EARN in game currency if you don't want to spend money. Hecc yeah.6. Missions - You complete missions for different people and you make the galaxy a better (or worse) place. You can also get standing with some of the many factions in the game who reward you for your efforts.7. Open worlds - Missions on open worlds and things to do like fish, fly around, capture animals, do bounties, etc.If I didn't convince you, fine. If I did, welcome to Warframe.

This game is a wonderful combination of all of the things that we want to see. Space. Dwarves. Mining (Who doesn't like Minecraft right?). And most importantly. Aliens. Swarms of aliens. Well, we call them bugs but yeah. You get the gist. If you want to be the dude that wipes out massive amounts of aliens, be a gunner. If you want to swing back and forth like Tarzan and mine twice as much materials as your team combined, be a scout. If you want to laze around and use an auto-shotty while your turrets do all the work, play engineer. If you find yourself getting lost in caves and you just want to mine your way out of any situation as well as use a badass flamethrower, play driller. All of the classes are fun and all of the missions are the same. Also, don't forget to spam V. ROCK AND STONE, BROTHERS!

Portal 2 has been sitting in my Steam library for years and years and I've always heard so much about it and how it's such a great game. I played a little hint of it here and there but never got to really experience it. Now, after completing it, I can see why it is easily one of the best games of all time. The satisfaction of puzzle solving, the memorable characters, the hilarity, and the absolutely grand ending have left me with a smile I can't wipe off my face. What a wonderful game. 10/10 would recommend.

An amazing game that you should definitely give a chance to. Everybody calls it a "walking simulator", but if you have actually played it, you will have realized what a truly beautiful game it is. If you like story heavy games, this is absolutely the choice for you, but if you're just going to skip all the cutscenes, then you would probably be better off getting something else. I read all the emails and alerts as I received them, and it was worth it. The world building and extra behind the scene details in this game are incredible.PROS:Amazing storyTremendous soundtrackRelaxing gameplay mixed with high tension moments that will have you at the edge of your seatMovie-like cutscenesInsanely fun movement sandboxAwesome online integrationCONS: Very long cutscenes (at the end)The action/shooter parts are spread out a bitConclusion: Give the game a chance, and you might find your new favorite game. It's a beautiful game with a great story, and an amazing music score that you'll remember for months after playing.

FALLOUT 3 G.O.T.Y: a ver..... este juego lo compre por ahi en junio-julio lo deje olvidado hasta recien unas semanas solo lo jugue para ver si funcionaba, luego lo deje totalmente abandonado y la verdad me arrepiento totalmente de ello, ya que disfrute y quede totalmente enamorado de este juego su mundo abierto tiene un monton de cosas que hacer. Como compre la version del juego del juego o G.O.T.Y tuve acceso a los 5 DLC del juego lo cual recomiendo totalmente ya que sale mas barato y primero rese√±are el juego base y luego los DLC por aparte cada uno.BASELo malo: el juego tiene algunas fallas como es normal con todo, para empezar la compatibilidad es algo que deberia mejorarse con algo no se... ya que el juego no esta bien optimizado para windows 10 y toca acceder a los archivos del juego para hacerle una ligera modificacion para evitar tanto crasheo pero no los elimina y eso es algo que fastidia un poco, tambien en algunas cosas en especial con la hermandad del acero estan mal traducidas ya sea en los subtitulos/opciones de dialogo/voces, tambien hay uno que otro bug y algun glitch por ahi pero en todos los juegos hay y mas aun con un mapa tan extenso como lo es el yermo capital. Otro fallo es el sistema de Karma del juego que si matas a un personaje malvado no te dice nada e incluso a veces te da karma pero si le robas algo de la casa de este personaje te da mal karma y eso es bastante contradictorio y gracioso.Lo bueno: el juego base tiene muchas cosas por hacer y una gran cantidad de misiones secundarias y misiones no marcadas con algunas recompensas bastantes buenas como la servoarmadura T-51 B o alguna que otra arma/atuendo unico por el yermo, los coleccionables principales del juego base son los cabezones que mejoran los atributos S.P.E.C.I.A.L y los otros atributos como medicina,ciencia,ganzua,reparacion,conversacion,etc. Estos cabezones son bastantes divertidos de encontrar y cada uno con un reto mayor a otro por ejemplo hay un cabezon en el santuario de los sanguinarios que para muchos es uno de los enemigos mas peligrosos del juego. Y hablando de los enemigos, este juego tiene una gran cantidad de enemigos variados como los famosos supermutantes, los horribles centauros, los peligrosos sanguinarios o deathclaws para los que lo jugaron en ingles, entre otros. La historia de este juego es bastante buena situando al enclave como enemigo principal del juego y se hacen odiar bastante, algo dificil para los enemigos de peliculas y juegos actuales. El juego te da opciones importantes y que te dejan pensando un rato en que hacer no solo por las recompensas si no por la cuestion moral. La ambientacion del juego es bastante buena y si te da ese sentimiento de desolacion y peligro en el yermo capital y tal como lo escucharon estamos el la capital de estados unidos y hay sombreros de Lincoln y su rifle que obviamente estaran en las ruinas del lugar pero de estar ahi pues estan ahi. OPERATION ANCHORAGELo malo: el DLC es bastante corto y me hubiera gustado que fuera un poco mas largo pero dentro del contexto de la historia esta bien...pero si me hubiera gustado que fuera un poco mas largo, los objetos que estan en ese DLC no son accecibles de manera legal o por lo menos algunos como la armadura de combate para inviernos o los uniformes chinos de invierno, no hay opcion de volver al DLC y en este mismo no puedes explorar libremente y los coleccionables principales del DLC que son los maletines son bastante perdibles por este mismo motivo.Lo bueno: las recompensas de este DLC se me hicieron mejores que algunas de otros DLC como la servoarmadura T-51 B para inviernos la cual creo que es la segunda mejor armadura del juego y su aspecto es bastante bueno, la armadura china de sigilo el cual la use bastante en el DLC mothership Zeta ahora no se bien si se consigue con los 10 maletines en la simulacion o no.....Pasando por la historia de este DLC pues que tengo que decir... te hace revivir la batalla en alaska entre china y estados unidos y el cual es bastante importante para la historia de Fallout BROKEN STEELLo malo: desaprovecharon varias oportunidades como un acompa√±ante nuevo que seria Stiggs con sus robots, otra cosa que desaprovecharon es el ataque del final y ojo que hay spoilers en el final tienes la opcion de lanzar los misiles satelitales hacia la ciudadela que te daria karma malvado o hacia la base movil del enclave que te dara buen karma pero hay otras opciones pero no estaran disponibles como Megaton y otros lugares seria bueno que si quieres ser extremadamente malvado dejaran estallar estos lugares y que cuando destruyas megaton te den asentamiento en la ciudadela por que claro podran pensar que fue la bomba atomica del lugar pero bueno es solo una opinion mia, otra cosa desaprovechada es para el karma malvado de nuevo y es que no hay la posibilidad de unirte al enclave despues de destruir la ciudadela.Lo bueno: para empezar este DLC te dejan explorar mas el yermo despues del final del juego base lo cual se agradece bastante , lo siguiente es que hace que albondiga sea practicamente inmortal y extremadamente fuerte pero eso si solo cuando has activado el DLC antes de agarrar a albondiga pero si quieres que albondiga sea inmortal y no tienes broken steel puedes hacer esto en la consola de comandos:setessencial 0006a772 1 ya cambiando de tema broken steel trae enemigos nuevos y por cierto mas fuertes por obvias razones ya deberias tener buen nivel pero igual saldran antes de terminar el juego y ten cuidado ya que son dificiles de matar y los nuevos enemigos son: Cacique supermutante, segadora de necrofago salvaje, mutascorpius albino, soldados sigma del enclave, soldados de fuego infernal del enclave y el maestro del arsenal que es un soldado del enclave unico. Tiene 3 misiones principales y 3 secundarias que dan un total de 6 pero hay misiones sin marcar que son un total de 4 y eso da un total de 10 misiones lo cual no esta nada mal .POINT LOOKOUT                        Lo malo: el DLC casi no me gusto tanto como los otros ya que tiene una ambientacion demasiado sucia y musgosa que a otros les puede gustar pero a mi no tanto, hay veces donde aparecen ordas y ordas de enemigos sin sentido y llega a fastidiar un poco, hay personajes que son imbeciles de sangre pero no es culpa del juego si no que asi son en la historia.Lo bueno: tiene una de las misiones mas interesantes y misteriosas del juego y es "El corazon oscuro de blackhall" que tiene una referencia al necronomicron y a Cthulhu que son de la mitologia de Lovecraft y esto en un juego como fallout estos aspectos misticos son interesantes de ver, hablando de las misiones tienen un total de 11 misiones 5 principales, 5 secundarias y 1 sin marcar, es el DLC mas grande del juego en terminos de mapa, misiones por hacer y enemigos que son: necrofago salvaje del pantano, hombre pinza del pantano o mirelurk,cazador hombre pinza del pantano, hombre pinza rey del pantano, follonero, gorila, rastreador, sigiloso, camorrista. THE PITTLo malo: te quitan las cosas al entrar, radiacion dificil de evitar y sanar ya que te quitaron tus cosas, poca variedad de enemigos, un mapa un poco reducido, no hay retorno al yermoLo bueno: La ambientacion de una Pittsburgh decaida y enferma es bastante buena y me gusta, una mision no marcada que te otorga una servoarmadura bastante buena, armas y armaduras de buen dise√±o, una mision que te da un pensamiento moral y un poco "fria" no quiero hacer mas spoilers pero es una mision principal cuando la jueguen lo sabran, capacidad de regresar cuando quieras exepto si no has terminado las misiones principalesMOTHERSHIP ZETALo malo: el coleccionable de este DLC no te da ninguna recompensa, para conseguir algunas armaduras unicas es necesario matar o robar a la gente, no hay capacidad de regresar a unas partes de la naveLo bueno: tiene la unica mercader que tiene reparacion 100, armaduras y armas unicas bastantes buenas, una pelea final bastante buena.

Arkham Origins...Bien, el juego esta bien es bastante divertido ademas de que el mapa es mas grande osea que hay mas exploracion yo la verdad sufri de bastantes Bugs como el que la capa cuando uno planea se vuelve medio loca que la textura del cabello de los NPC se desaparecen al acercase quedando como si fueran calvos como Shiva que aparece calva en mi juego si steam lee esto espero que me ayuden con estos errores ya que le resta bastante experiencia del juego. Hablando ya de lo que es el juego sin el tema de los Bugs es bastante entrenido la historia es buena pero no tiene ese feeling de los arkham anteriores, las Boss Fights son las mejores de los 3 que he jugado (Asylum ,City, Origins) la mejor de todas es la de Death stroke, hay algunas fallas temporales pero creo que son por el bien del Gameplay como la de el Boost al engancharte con la batclaw se supone que en el City es un prototipo que incluso alfred no esta seguro de usarla, pero en este es el mismo alfred que te recomienda usarla. Le doy un 8/10 por los problemas de Bugs y los peque√±os fallos argumentales

Este juego es la continuacion de Arkham Asylum, este es un gran juego con gran historia y las misiones secundarias son aun mas interesantes como la del Sombrerero, la de Riddler, la de Bane, etc. Este mundo abierto es bastante bueno y lo recomiendo totalmente, lo unico que me quedo a deber es que no se pueda cambiar el idioma al ingles y la interfaz en espa√±ol de forma "normal" y que para ello toca acceder a los archivos del juego, gran dise√±o de personajes, buen dise√±o de mapa, historia oscura y acorde a el personaje, grandes referencias a las peliculas de Tim Burton y los comics, recomendado totalmente 9.5/10

Brotherhood la continuacion de Assassin's Creed 2 no es mejor pero es muy recomendable vale la pena invertir dinero para comprar este juego :)Bueno pues como ven ya he jugado 70 hrs este juego, la verdad no pense que tuviera tantas misiones secundarias como las de la hermandad que te dan la espada de altair la espada mas mmdissima del juego, los puntos de Uplay que te dan al comprar este juego sirven para canjearlos por contenido extra como la de La desaparicion de Leornardo o mejoras para Ezio.En el anterior se enfocaba la venganza de ezio en este se enfoca mas en la recuperacion de Roma y en el crecimiento del personaje para dejar de ser un aprendiz a pasar a ser a un mentor de la hermandadSi no estoy mal utiliza el mismo motor que el 2 pero de eso no estoy muy seguro, explorar Roma a caballo es una de las cosas mas relajantes que hay y las graficas del juego no se quedan atras y apoyan este sentimiento. 8/10

I absolutely love that game. It's a shame I won't be able to finish this because of technical problems. First my computer just turned off after 30 minutes in game. Then each time I played it my CPU was overheating(AMD FX 6300), randomly crashing every now and then. Despite that I wanted to finish the game but after another crash when game was saving I'm not able to run it from that save anymore.But if you wan't to try it anyway(maybe it's just my PC) it's a great game. If you like scavenger hunts, if you ever got lost in the woods and enjoyed finding way back just using map and compass - you're going to have fun with this game.

I like that game and you will like it too if:a) You like to see new creative ideas in games(nothing totaly crazy but The Novelist certainly has that fresh look)b) You find it engaging to read those novels with mediocore story but well written.You can easily see that's low budget game but author gave all his passion in it.

Art is beautiful, music is amazing, story keeps in suspense whole time, atmosphere is incredible. Last time I felt so hard tension when I played first Silent Hill. There were just few moments when I wasn't sure where should I go next/how to solve a riddle but that's the case of every point and click adventure I think.A masterpiece.

Incredibly well written story, the way characters are built, how dialogues make you feel actually important, like your choices really matter. It's absolutely brilliant and I can't recall any other RPG that managed to do that so wonderfully. Too bad I would not be able to see how that story ends. Combat is awful, tactics are totally counter intuitive, dungeons are sometimes too long and dull. Difficulty settings are totally unbalanced. I played it on normal and it was good for first 10 hours maybe. Then every battle got awfuly long and boring. After switching to easy game was... easy. No challenge at all.Maybe it's just not game for me but after promising beginning, it came out different than expected. I feel disappointed.PS. Also stepping on these "BUY DLC TO PLAY THAT QUEST" is so annoying.

Thing that enchanted me from the very beginning: lovely sense of humour! If character saying "There's something special about sticking a cold, wet fish in your pocket" after putting a fish into your inventory, makes you smile - then that's probably game for you. It's typical oldschool adventure game. You walk around, grab objects and solve puzzles. These are usually simple, yet enjoyable. Some are out of ordinary and make you laugh, some are usual for that type of game. I would say that game is perfect if not that sometimes it's ridiculous, like the moment when I had to find recipe ingredient among the books - how your supposed to figure that out? But it's not very often and if you're stuck, there's a great, detailed guide on steam. Story at first appears to not be anything special but I liked the ending. World is weird but really believable. Voice overs are great, couldn't get enough of listening main character lines, it often wasn't funny by itself - actor made it amusing!tl;dr - That's just wonderful game :)

This game is simply amazing, the amount of content packed inside is enough to leave you with at MINIMUM 50 hours of game-play. The nights feel like they go on FORRREEEVVERRR, and the days feel so quick, all because of the very intense enemies and fear of the unknown. Essentially you are a man, insignificant in this world, and powerless, simply surviving after awaking in the middle of the forest and being kidnapped by a terrifying doctor, the main antagonist, whom has stole your 'key'. It's better if you learn more AS you go, rather then reading reviews with ANY type of spoilers as experiencing this first hand is just AMAZING. One tip before you go, don't stay out at night time, trust me.

This game is amazing, I've always dreamt of being an Italian war veteran turned-mobster in the 1920's. If you want to be that too, buy this game. Also definitive edition released which is basically a remaster.

Imagine the classic Mutilate a Doll series from the old browser days, now amplify it 10 times with gore, physics, details and community. This game is updated at LEAST once a month with 5-10 new items along with bug fixes, maps and plenty more. I recommend getting this game on sale though, as the $15 price tag is slightly steep, at least for me that is. Right now (3rd July 2020) the game is at a extremely comfortable price of $3.There is no story, just pure sandbox game-play, to live out your sick, sick fantasies of shoving giant metal rods down a innocent little ragdoll man's throat, ripping his intestines in half and sticking a needle into his leg to heal his guts back, for him to explode again from the metal rods.The game is that detailed you can do that, believe me.I highly recommend this game at a cheaper price as it has a solid 20+ of content for a low price.Oh and also did I mention the new steam workshop option too?

Many people say this game is a bad port from the PS3/XBOX360 era, and the true answer to that is... kinda.The game is solid, the story is great, gameplay great, very detailed with NPC details and other things for a game which is 12 years old now. This game is arguably better in nearly all aspects than its predecessor, Grand Theft Auto V. Just don't bother with that game or its multiplayer, believe me, it's not worth it compared to this game. You see, the only downfalls to this game is port, which isn't TERRIBLE compared to many other crappy ports, its just the frame-rate and LOD factors which are funky, even with high end gaming PC's like mine. But then again, its not terrible, at least for me. Just because the port is kinda mediocre does not mean you shouldn't pick this game up, it's very worth your time. The story is like 30+ hours and very detailed and feels like a genuine AAA experience, it's a fine wine.Verdict: Just ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô?get it

This free 3d design software is one of the best ones i have ever used. At the beginning of my journey using blender, it was quite hard to navigate the scene as it had some weird keybinds, but as you keep using it it will definitely get easier. I suggest to watch a few tutorials first to get a bit of an understanding of how it works and what you can do inside this software.

The game does indeed look great, though there are still many issues to this day that should be fixed, but havent since releaseThe VR version is very scuffed, if you like VR games I would highly suggest not playing thisThe AI for the animals on planets feel janky and fly into the ground at any possible moment you look at themFlying around in space also feels unpolished, and is better with a controllerA really big thing that probably a lot of players (myself included) is the navigation system for objectives, it is not very clear and you have to do guesswork to know what you are doing

It has a very nice concept it was interesting enough for me to spend some time (well most of the time going through the horrendous lag for the sake of achievements) getting in-depth mechanics and information about the game since they really don't give much in the so called tutorial; I literally spent my first gameplay trying to survive not knowing what to do.Few bugs here and there, if the devs would pay attention to this game (since they made a sequel) and actually fix them I would recommend paying in full price. Otherwise, meh, just wait for a sale or a giveaway of some sort.6.75/10

Never thought I'd love this game so much. Bought it when I had some cash left in my wallet since I don't really enjoy playing RPG Maker games, but this game definitely changed my mind. It's pretty straight-forward, controls are pretty basic (well duh), battles aren't that hard once you get the hang of it and the humor is just clever, definitely the best part of the game.8/10, would bribe a rat again.

This game, although relatively short, makes it to my top list. I don't really like short games in general (with price like this), but for this one, I'll give it an exception. The story was, meh, in a way. It really had a mystery there but left me hanging at the end. To this point I'm still wondering what the hell goes on after that. What stands out in this game for me was the graphics. I'm running on a toaster but it's still capable of delivering the high settings of this game. And damn is that graphic good. Sometimes less is more. Another thing that I like are the voice actors. There aren't many characters in this game, however, the voice actors did an astonishing job in delivering their own characters. I haven't heard a good video game voice actor in a while.And of course, the walk. I don't know what else to say about the walk. It's just surreal.
Overwatch: I'm Broke Edition

What is Life?Probably the only video game that makes me question my morality, quite literally. The day after I finished this game, I literally question everything that I've done up to then, how I value this life, how I embrace it, and especially everything regarding my closed ones. No video game has ever done that to me, really. And this one, man it's only 10 hours short but I could go all day just to think about it. Call me melancholist but hey, we all got feels. The ending was the hardest part. I chose to be rational by sacrificing Chloe and my own choice hit me hard. Title says everything, life IS strange.Spend your cash on this game, really. The only thing I regret about this game is not paying full price for episode 1 (before it went free).

This is awesome game.ICE Entertainment had a great idea to bulid "Naval Fleets Battles" like Steel OceanNice Quality Ships (some warships need visual repair), really easy control, like in WW2 your ship must Go Straight to hit the other ship (the best accuracy).Here you will find all classes of warships: BB, DD, CV, CL, CA, SFree Game with Mini Cost (Good Prices).But this game has some minus:- Difficult control in submarine;- Not many people in game (You can easy fight to IV sometimes to V tier);- There isnt Eu Server (Only German Proxy = not bad, but not good enough wiht ping 150)- This game need some advertisement- You can fight in 16 vs 16 ... ... ... but more time you spend on 8 vs 8 or sometiems 3 vs 3 (It's true)Would this game be a competition for "World of Warships"?At the moment - "NO".Maybe when ICE will do something about that, or maybe they are doing something, but this is still future (unknown).Steel Ocean is still young game, but I can see some lights in black tunnel.

This game is TRASH in its current state. Sure, a lot of your friends play it and want to you to join them on their sweat-filled, ass clenching, agonising journey to that sweet sweet diamond rank. But in the end, it really isn't worth it in a static ass game like this. There isn't any actual dynamism to the game play once you really get into it. The same strats, the same maps that people pick because they're too scared to lose their precious elo to a map they're unfamiliar with and of course, the same stupid operator bans despite many available counters and/or better bans to go for, but no, we must mirror what the pro demi-gods of this game do because we are definitely playing the game the same way they do. Oh yeah, Ubisoft doesn't know how to balance or protect their game by the way. While on this aforementioned ranked grind you'll also experience these delightful encounters with hackers. Most aren't blatant and you'll most likely never clock you're against/with a closet hacker on your team until you load up the game and are subdued to multiple elo roll backs due to hackers getting banned, in turn ridding your account of the precious ass clenching, sweat-filled, agonising barely-worth-it elo that you spent hours gaining. A majorly braindead playerbase full of Midlands inbreds, French frogs with aspergers, and closet homosexual arabs, its truly  a mostly infuriating experience on this game, not because of any toxicity per se (real men/women can handle that toxicity or simply tap on that tantalising mute button you always hover over, doubting yourself constantly, thinking that muting that inbred British kid might not be worth just so you're able to get that sweet, sweet information), but rather due to the short-comings of the incompetent developers at Ubisoft who seem to be just winging it as they go with no long-term vision for the game they seemingly unintentionally developed into the current hellscape that commonly referred to as Rainbow Six Seige. Purchase this game at your own risk.Also where the ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• is Bartlett University?

I can't really recommend this game. Yes, you run a shelter, but it feels like you're running a Petsmart instead. Game wants you to unlock more stuff, and the only way to get money in this game is to put pets up for adoption. So, you're incentivized to get as many pets as possible, quickly raise their adoption stat and then put them up for adoption so that you can get money. You can feed and water them once, pet them, then a minute later their adoption stat is high enough to put them up for adoption. So instead of taking care of pets and run an actual shelter, it feels like you're just running a pet store with goal of selling as many animals as possible.Game would've been much better if it was much harder to raise adoption stat, so that you actually have to tend to pet's daily needs instead of just quickly patching them up once, washing them, petting them, feeding them and then boom, getting them out for money. Taking care of your animals should give donation money or something, so that you don't have to get rid of them so quickly to be able to afford other things. Overall I played for 5 hours and outside of unlocking more expensive buildings, which yet again, means I just have to grind putting pets up for adoption, I feel I've experienced everything this game has to offer. It's really a shame because it's such a cute game, but I can't even build a bond with an animal if the game wants me to get rid of it as soon as possible so that I can get some money. I hope devs rework economy part of this game, and you actually have to run a shelter, not a Petsmart where you just rid of animals ASAP.

This game is really good. It has plenty of PVE content if you do not want to do Rust style PVP. Combat is fun and being a vampire with awesome powers feels great. There's lots of progression and castle building is easy and satisfying. I recommend it for PVE, I haven't tried PVP but from the sounds of it I wouldn't like it, but PVE has a lot of content to satisfy you for many hours while you kill bosses and grind gear and castle upgrades.

Now I don't normally play battle royales, but I love Masquarade so I had to give this a try, and I must say, this is the most fun I've had in a battle royale. The game is really brawley - you spawn, you grab a gun and you kill ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•. No huge map that makes you not encounter any action for minutes at a time. Also you get extra lives in solo so if you die you don't have to requeue which means more waiting, not playing. I recommend to try this game. It's fun and not your typical slow battle royale. I also am not a fan of battle royale genre but this game has so much action it's almost like a brawley arena, so if you're not a fan of battle royale like me, you might like this.

Bought the game on a whim, based on a few people I know enjoying it. Didn't know much about it before I started playing. At the point of writing this, I have completed the main storyline, passed the cauldron in the expansion area storyline (The Cut), and also completed probably 75%+ of the collectibles (though I can't see me finishing them off).Thoroughly enjoyed the main storyline, which details how the current 'world' came about.Things which I think could be improved:* Climbing routes are denoted with white/yellow markings (semi-puzzles in some cases, especially the expansion area), sometimes these weren't really visible. They should be highlighted with the focus, this would remove the annoyance when feeling stuck half way through a route (and then needing to fall off, to get a better view).* When walking past NPCs in populated areas, you will hear them say phrases. There seems to be about 5-10 phrases on loop, regardless of where you are. So after a while it just becomes annoying to hear the same things over and over.* Deathbringer is an awful machine to fight, it will often end up super high in the air directly above you. Where you can't aim anywhere close to vertically up, I'm not sure what the trick for killing it is supposed to be.* You can cheese many of the large machine fights, by taking advantage of the fact all machines (except mounts) are tied to a certain area. So you can often stand slightly outside of their area behind an obstacle and tackle them whilst taking minimal damage. This is a bit harder with some of the largest machines, which can destroy large parts of the environment, but still possible.* Controlling mounts always felt a bit janky so I generally preferred to travel on foot. Also, trying to pick up plants whilst on mount often ended up in being mistimed, and me jumping off the mount.* When dying/loading save, my equipped weapon/arrow would always return to hunting arrows, rather than hard point/whatever I was previously using. Tedious.* Blast wire seems a bit OP,  really easy to kill some of the machines with it (Frostclaws probably being the worst offender in this case)* The expansion area (The Cut) introduces some new mechanics (snow storms when you're outside making visiblity awful, more puzzle-esque climbing route, 'cursed machines'). In general, I think these could have all done with a bit more QA, they don't feel as smooth and player friendly as the main game's content.Don't let this criticism take away from the positive review though, the main storyline is thoroughly worth playing.  The post credits scene, suggests there might be a sequel following Syler, I'd like to see that.

Fun game with a large group of friends (e.g. 6+), but the incentives need changing to improve public players. Has a few rough edges, but well worth the low price if you have people to play with.Currently many players joining public matches instantly leave games whereby they don't end up imposter. This can leave games balanced for 10 players, with as few as 5 players (2 imposter, 3 crew) straight after the game has started. At this point, only one crew needs to die for the imposters to have won. Rendering the game pointless. A solution to this could be giving players a 5-10 minute timeout from public games, if they leave a game before they have been killed/ejected (though this could also backfire with players afk in cafe at start).There are harder to solve problems with public games, whereby players will out themselves as the imposter. This somewhat renders them a problem now, as if they aren't playing a long con, you can be sure they are never the imposter. I'm less sure how to remedy this, other than not playing public games (or replacing find server with matchmaking and player rankings etc, but that adds a whole host of complexity).In terms of gameplay, there are a wide range of settings which can be modified in hosted games. These can vastly unbalance the gameplay when abused (e.g. harming crew, improving imposters).My primary complaint however, would be that when an imposter you can't click vents to enter them. You instead have to click the vent button. This regularly catches me out, making me slower to enter vents. Consistency of clicking things to do tasks across the board would be useful.Oh and the swipe card task can be annoying until you learn the appropriate swipe speed.

Poor storyline (to be expected with Just Cause games, that's not really why you play them), made 100x worse by loads of cutscenes, all of which are unskippable. Several missions consist of nothing but a 10 minute cutscene which unlocks a different mission on the otherside of the map. The final mission of the main storyline, you probably spend longer in cutscenes than you do actually completing objectives.Otherwise, game has much the same usual just cause gameplay (essentially invulnerable, fly around with a grapple destroying things and killing enemies, the missions are very forgiving in this regard, if you do die you only restart the current checkpoint or less). However, instead of capturing individual bases, you now complete a mission which enables you to 'move troops' into a region. You're supposed to unlock spare troops by earning chaos points, but it appears to be broken, because i kept gaining troops by unlocking regions. Ended the game with 19 spare troops and all regions unlocked, about 5 levels below max chaos. They should have kept it simple like the previous games, destroy a base, it turns blue.The expansion pack content is pretty eh, the demon/alien one really doesn't fit the game (I also uncovered a bug, where if i entered the demon dome in a helicopter, completion of the objectives didn't move the mission on until i died which reset them. The underground car battles one just wasn't my thing (drive a car that has built on guns around a track and get a high enough score to proceed). The agency one is actually kind of fun, as it introduces some novel content (enemies with grapples, new weapons/vehicles).The game also has way too many collectible tasks to complete to earn all the unlocks, something like 150 speed challenges, 150 pass this vehicle through this ring, 150 wingsuit challenges (pass through 2-4 rings). Most are easy to complete with a couple of attempts, a few make no obvious sense. Then there are about 15 each, elite ring and vehicle challenges, most of which are ridiculous and require you trying to get a boat inland and other stupid things. At the time of writing the review, I think i've got about 50% of all the none elite tasks, and im way too fatigued to finish.
Really fun, just watch out for any furniture near your play space.The safe mode kinda helps with this.
Make sure to play the free demo level first, doesn't feel significantly different from the previous Hitman game.

Refreshingly novel concept for a puzzle game. Simple enough gameplay that it can be casually approached without explanation.Took me around 30 minutes to reach level 12 where I first got stuck. So I expect the total playtime will come in around 2-3 hours, reasonable considering the cost. (I'll try to remember to update the review when I get that far).Cons:* The alternate zoom out camera is a bit arkward to control* Minor graphical artifacts (dark pixels that flicker for a second or two), some of these seem to appear at the seams between blocks, the cause of other less frequent artiefacts is unclear.

This game has combat near identical to the batman games, with the addition of some car-car combat, presumably a consequence of the same publisher/game engine.It plays similarly to batman/far cry/just cause, whereby you roam an open world completing templated tasks (clearing camps/landmines, removing scarecrows/snipers scavenging collectibles and capturing trophies from convoys). With an additional storyline providing missions which unlock extra areas of the map and a few car upgrades.These activities net you scrap and some form of points, which you can use to upgrade your vehicle/equipment and bonuses respectively, whilst also reducing 'threat' in the area which should mean less enemies are roaming (this is implied by the game, but not 1sure if it's as effective as suggested). Game has some minor issues:* I've had enemies despawn for no visible reason during combat.* 20 hours into the game, having cleared Jeet's whole territory and most of Gutgash. I've only needed to jump twice. They keybinding is left ctrl, but this is not introduced anywhere during the game, so by the time you reach the need 15 hours in you probably assume there is no jump. However it's been necessary to access one hot air balloon and one loot (in a train carriage in the eastern tunnels). I googled the prior and found a steam community thread discussing it.* Default volume settings, car engine sounds are way too loud for my taste relative to voices. I haven't attempted to change this in settings yet, I just adjust my physical volume knob for speakers regularly.* Until you do enough story to get the explosive car weapon, some activities  seem a little off limits.* Usual issue whereby I suck at combat when I'm swarmed by 15 enemies and can't keep them all on screen at once, 5+ of which have special abilities. There's probably some strategy for this that I'm missing.General verdict is that if you like open world games with templated tasks you will probably enjoy this, otherwise you won't.I bought it in a sale for 75% off and it seems well worth it given the time I've spent playing it thus far.

Compelling story, and attractive art style in both terms of graphics and soundtrack. Lots of chances for screenshots. Took me around 2.5 hrs to complete.Not sure whether I will bother to give it a further play through now I've completed the storyline (to finish the achievements).Worth buying if you're comfortable with the price/hr ratio.

Game plays similar to predecessors. Due to it's pricing model, you can grab the game and the initial episode for a steal at 50% off in a sale to decide whether you like it enough to buy any more episodes or even the upgrade pack.So far I've enjoyed playing the first episode enough over the space of 6 hrs to buy the 2nd before the sale ends.As with my experience with the previous hitman games, takes me a few runs through a mission to get comfy enough to enjoy it.

In terms of gameplay No Mans Sky has several things going for it;It's famed procedural generation, there are many beautiful and diverse landscapes you can discover within this game.It's mysterious lore, as the game is newly released and the developers were quite tight lipped regarding the lore surrounding the game, there's quite a drive to unlock and discover many of the games secrets.However once you get past these things, the game comes down to being another waypoint collector with an (infinitely) large map, whether you are ok with that at this price is very subjective (there are lots of AAA titles with similar mechanics, this simply has a greater focus on exploration than combat).The game has several issues in it's current state. It currently freezes up fairly regularly during game-play for several seconds at a time and it also crashes out every few hours (it simply closes instantly, without showing an error or similar). If you do manage to play the game for ~4 hours straight without crashing, you might find that the FPS suddenly drops leaving the game unplayable until you close it and reopen (I'd guess this is caused by a memory leak).It seems very likely that these issues will however be worked out over time as the developers have committed to expanding the game with free dlc in the future.
