I don't usually do reviews, however this game is exceptional!I've had around 10 hours of in-server play, and I've used all the weapon types, and I can easily say that this is my favorite shooter at the moment.Pros:- Fast TTK, but not to fast like CoD- Good objective gametypes- Quality community (for the most part)- Seems rather balanced (some weapons can use work)- Based on a good anime, seems to have original English dub voice actors- Team centered 'class' skills- Is cheapCons:- Lack of Auto-Balance- Only a few maps- Will be F2P, so might become P2W?- Spectating can be buggy- Early Access still (Not really a con?)- Can't use shooting range with un-purchased guns/mods- randomized spray pattern might need workAll in all, I would recommend this game (and have been) to anyone who likes shooters, or likes the anime series. I've not been a fan of most modern shooters with their abundance of guns, and toxic communities, as well as long respawns (in the games I've played at least). This has been a nice breath of fresh air, for me at least.If you have $5, pick this up and have some fun, or wait until it's F2P and join us then, it's well worth your time and 45 minutes worth of work* (assuming you make minimum wage in the US?).EDIT: There is a CS style AWP type weapon - It's the .50 cal with the damage enhancing barrel. It only has 4 mags though, and with such a low TTK, it's easy to get killed with, a skilled sniper can still make use of it though. I think It should be made bolt-action for fairness, however it should not be nerfed damage wise. It wouldn't make sense for a .50 cal round to only wound someone.

With this review I want to show some negatives of Mafia: Definitive edition and why I wouldnt really recommend it.If we were looking at Mafia as its own thing, the game would be good. But the issue is that it isnt its own thing. There is competition that does much better for the similar price tag.I bought this game because of its "open world" tag, thinking that it would be similar to gta 5, but in a different setting. Of course I was hoping for the game to have its own unique spin on the open world genre, but what happend really disappointed me. (Just a heads up; this review will have some comparisons between gta 5 and mafia)The game IS open world, but you cant do a whole lot with this world. Instead of having a open world game with a story, this is a story set in the open world, meaning that instead of having a lot to do in the open world, the only thing you actually do is missions. But those arent the main issues I have with the game. In a single mission I encountered TWO bugs, not even 30 minutes into the playthrough. For those wondering, its the second chapter. The game instructs me to sprint, and I see the valley that I decide to run towards. Only to be blocked by some magical wall (??) causing me to lose the mission. No big deal, I restart from last checkpoint and manage to run through the valley. Now Im told to vault over the fence. I do it. I continue to run and now I have to vault onto some crates (??) and now I fall through the world and die.... That all happend in the span of couple of minutes. Right there and then I though of quitting the game, but part of me tought that the odds of this happening are low so I kept on playing.The driving camera feels odd to say the least. The gun gameplay feels ok, but it lacks that oomph. In gta for example the whole screen greys out and zooms in for a short period while showing the little x, which feels awesome. The controls for anything that isnt gun related are weird though.... Why cant I press m1 to smack someone with the bat? Instead I have to spam q for whatever reason.And finally the language. I really love when a character in 1930s says "stop bustin my balls". The game isnt bad and I can see why the game has so many positive reviews, but it isnt my cup of tea. I dont think its worth 40‚Ç?especially when gta 5 which costs 50% more offers MUCH more. Not to mention that gta 5 often goes on sale meaning you can get it for even less than 60‚Ç? I would recommend buying this game only if its on sale, and only then.

This game is amazing, however there are a couple of problems I have with it. Overall the game is fun, you can spend a whole day without getting bored because this game is just so much fun. The things I like Ok first lets start with the good parts. Firstly you can play any nation which existed at that time, and even if it didn't, you can tag the country which owned it at that time, and chances are, you can release that nation. Also the default focus tree is amazing. While it doesn't provide anything historicaly related with that nation, it provides the nation with a couple of military factories, civilian factories, infastructure, option to quickly change the ideology, option to develop your airforce and navy, and to get a couple of research bonuses. Also if you have waking the tiger dlc, almost every nation gets the option to form the nation at which they were the biggest (ie. Iran can form the Persian Empire). Also even tough good portion of nations don't have the custom focus tree, by every dlc, new focus trees for nations get added, and old custom focus trees which have some flaws get reworked. What I really like is how you can pick many alternative routes. Wanna go trotskiyist soviet union? No problem. Want to make america communist while you play fascist britain? No problem, just pick in game rules for america to go communist route or go non historical. One thing I also really like is the achievements. Some of them sound funny, but the reason I love them is because how hard some of them are, and it makes you feel amazing when you get them, and sort of it tells other how good you are. I also love things such as resistance which make hoi4 realistic, however there are some problems which I will mention below with it. I love the research system and I love how you can't research everything instantly, making you decide what do you want. Do you want a strong army and airforce or strong navy and airforce or strong army and navy? It is up to you to decide. While it is restricting, for people searching for a challenge it makes it more fun, and in multiplayer games it makes it more balanced and it requires more teaming. And finally, the thing I absolutely adore is how easy it is to get the mods and how many mods there are, which can variate form a small colour change, to a change in whole timeline or era. Also the music is amazing, most of them are relaxing. Those are all the things I like about hoi4, now it's time to talk about couple of problems.  The things I don't like One thing I don't like about hoi4 are the Soviets. They aren't hard or realistic. Germany can without a strugle DESTROY the Soviets. While The Great Purge debuff is amazing, there are really small buffs later on, which doesn't presure Germany into declaring the war in 1941. or earlier. The only strong thing about the Soviets are their manpower and the Stalin line. As soon as you go trough the Stalin line, the game for the Soviets is pretty much over. Other thing which makes me dislike hoi4 a bit is the power of airforce. It is too powerful. You can literally make 1000 planes and make them kamikaze strike english channel or make them naval bomb and you DESTROY the royal navy. And while there are ways to counter that, it takes a giant effort to get rid of this problem if you don't have a good airforce. Now I already mentioned how I don't like something about resistance. That something is that you don't get that people uprise against you, the worst thing that can happen to you if you don't take care about resistance is to lose factories in that region. The last thing I don't like is about a dlc.  Death or dishonor  . You can buy it if you want or not, and that is why I won't complain how little it changes, but the things I don't like is that Yugoslavia doesn't have partizan uprizing.Those were all the things I liked and hated about hoi4. Of course I absolutely love this game, but it wouldn't be a proper review if I didn't include some minor things which sometimes irritate me.  DLCs  Together for Victory A really amazing dlc, adds a better puppet managment and focus trees for the british colonies and a better focus tree + Britain itself. Overall it is really amazing and you get a good protion for its price Death or Dishonor This dlc adds the least content and actually just adds focus trees for Yugoslavia, Romania and Hungary. The price is questionable, if you come from any of these countries I guess that it is worth it??? Waking the Tiger This dlc is worth its price. It reworks chinese overlords focus trees, and Japan. Also adds the option to form nations like I mentioned in the "the things I like" section. It also adds the better unit managment (force attack, last stand....). Personaly one of my favourite dlcs. Man the Guns The most recent dlc which adds most stuff into it. Personaly I like some things, and some I don't (like USA being op af with infinite oil) but overall I like it. I did read some reviews and some don't like it, some do so yeah, in the end it is up to you weather or not you want to buy a certain dlc or not. Conclusion I would of course give this game 10/10There are a lot of things you can do in hoi4, and whenever a new dlc comes out, pretty much the whole meta changes because of how much stuff they add, and that is what I love. Dlc are also amazing and if you really love this game and want to buy them, you should.

Amazing game, has great story and even greater gameplay. I absolutely love this game. I love how this game doesn't just focus on land, but you must focus on navy too, and if you don't, then you're screwed. I also like how every troop has its own unique ability, which can either be used to make your unit stronger, making it vonerable for a shorter period of time, or just as a last chance for your unit to survive/defend your base. I love how mcv can go into water, which gives you a chance to actually survive if the enemy dominates the land. The plot is nice, and just like in ra it shows the corruption among the soviets. I recommend this game to everyone who loves strategy games, because it just offers so much. I also like the "research tree" and how it works. I love how I can get some special ability without building anything, and how I gain experiance over time.Now the part which I don't like. To me, naval gameplay feels forced, because it is in every mission, and good amount of missions you can't actually make vehnicles made for land only because at the start you are on the island. Exept that I don't have any other problems, and I know that this problem may be contradictory because I said how I love that you must build navy, which is true, but I don't like being forced to build my navy absolutely every mission I play.

This game is amazing, full of items and full of bosses. If you're a sandbox fan and you love challenging yourself, then this is the best game, which will complete those two requirements. Even tho many people at first think this game is like minecraft, it isn't, and btw stop thinking that any sandbox which looks blockish is a minecraft, because it isn't, and this game is a perfect example of it. At first, for beginers and people which have entered in hardmode, they may find this game overwelming, but once you complete this game first time, you will pretty much know the whole game. PRETTY MUCH. There are so many items, each run can be completed differently. Sometimes you may complete this game multiple times, and then later discover a new item. Even tho at first. since is a 2d game, players may think that that is a limitation in certain ways, but I can tell you now, devs have manished to completly remove that 2d limitation. Game is fun and full of items, just like mentioned before, but there are also biomes, from which every single biome has its respective mobs. Bosses are fun and exciting, and even tho you have to beat some bosses to progress (otherwise you can't complete the game), it doesn't really feel like it. You can summon the boss yourself, or randomly encounter it. Not every boss is a must fight. Almost every prehardmode boss can be bypasses, and you can instantly kill a boss which puts you into so called "hardmode". For those who are interested what hardmode is, it is just like a new start of the game, but harder, and no, that doesn't mean that your items get deleted or world, you keep the items, but there are more mobs and more biomes, and also most importantly, new bosses and items. For sandbox fans this will be amazing game, as they can explore, build, fight and craft. So I recommend you to buy this game, because you will have so much fun in it. Personaly I am not a big sandbox fan, I would much rather prefer fps or rts games, but this game has so much to offer, that I absolutly love it. Now the other part of the review, a bad part. Game is just like I said overwelming for new players or players which are first time in hardmode. When I was first time playing terraria I had terraria wiki open 24/7 to know how to craft stuff or how to obtain certain items, but again, like I said, once you complete terraria first time, you will know how to complete it second time. I recommend you to watch youtubers or streamers play it to learn a bit more and being on terraria wiki, and even try creating few worlds so that you find a perfect one for the first time, that way you wont have problems obtaining items required to defeat the bosses, that doesn't mean that you should get one item, then hop to your main world, make one more world, get items there and repeat this process, no. That means that you should make one world in which you will easily find items and caves, and make that your main world, and play ONLY on it with one character. Another problems is how long it takes to obtain certain items, lets say terra blade, since I am tired of explaining, just click  here [terraria.gamepedia.com]. And even tho it is true that is takes forever to obtain lets say, terra blade, they made it really rewarding. Now since I did defend bad sides you may say that I am being "fanboyish" towards terraria, and I will be honest, that may be true. But that is because I love this game, and I hope that many good updates will come out in the future. Terraria rating: 10/10Edit: Also to mention, in terraria forums, there are a LOT of mods you can have fun with once you have beaten the game, or even before, and community is really nice.

The game is outstanding, beautiful and I love it. That is my opinion in short, so if you have just wanted to know my opinion in short, here you go, now time for full explanation what do I like and what I don't like I like how in this cnc game we went from 2d technology to 3d technology, and it really gives this game some beautiful and stunning graphics. What I don't like is that you have removed almost every building and vehnicle and character from older cnc games, and yes I do understand that there weren't any vehnicles or characters or buildings from cnc 1 that could have been made by you (except if you used mods) in cnc 2, but cnc 2 had a lot of easter eggs which are reffering to cnc 1 + when you're battling against mutants, you see them use older vehnicles from cnc 1, and also in the last mission on gdi side, if you're quick enought, you can also get to use tanks from cnc 1, also there were a lot of missions where buildings from cnc 1 were in hidden places, but ok, lets get back to cnc 3. There weren't a lot of easter eggs, but what I do like is new side, scrin. It really explains some stuff about tiberium and its exsistance on planet earth. Another thing I am not big fan of is the effectivity of weapons. It just feels like that you have to make at least 20 vehnicles (from which 10 are at least anti soliders and other 10 anti buildings/vehnicles), while in older games you could just build one same vehnicle or troop 10-20 times and you would complete the mission, but I still like that you have to mix vehnicles and not just spam, lets say titans in cnc 2. I like the game it is really well made and I would recommend it to everyone. Also I like that you can turn buildings and turn your view. Sadly servers are now dead so I couldn't have had fun exploring techniques while meeting different people. This game is probably togheter with ra3 one of the last good remains of cnc franchise, since newest released cnc game, looks nothing like classic cnc games. Westwood had some really amazing and creative ideas for cnc 3, but since ea had them, their ideas didn't even mean something to ea, so they fired them, and you can really see that this game looks like half westwood product because there are some ideas which definently look like from cnc franchise and yet there are some thing in this game which don't look at all like older cnc games. And cnc 4 was just a proof that ea run of westwoods ideas.

Before I start saying anything good or bad abour cs:go I will instantly say, I love it. Game is fun, it isn't that one game with cool graphics and bad content, it has ok graphics which even low spec computers can handle  and still the game is really fun and really well known.However, even tho the game is great, like every game, even cs:go has some bad sides. First of all ranking system. Elo system may be precise and good in big ranks, but in silver it is unbalanced. You can see 3 players in your team having 15-17 kills and then 2 of your team mates with less than 10 kills. Second of all, competitive is too stresful. I am writing this by my own expiriance, and even tho some people are not stresed, I am one of those people which are stresed when they play cs:go.Now back to the good sides. Most of the weapons are balanced, and even tho terrorists have weapon advantage over ct's, ct's have advantage over points, they are controling them.In the conclusion, I love the game,  and I can't wait to see future updates of this game!

Sometimes I question my life decisionsYou can speed run this game in under 2 minutes
Basically it's a RTS Version of RobocraftDesign space-ships. Program AI (optional). Batlle people.

BASICALLY: IT'S A SOLID GAME AND YOU SHOULD TRY IT (16/09/2017)PROS:+ Game can run on potato+ Newb friendly gunplay+ Generous in game currency (getting perm weapons is easy)+ FREE DLC TO TRY ALL BASIC GUNS FOR 15 DAYS+ Finding a populated game is easy+ Regular updates+ NOT PAY2WIN+ Anti-cheat seems to work+ Weapon balance is on point (except shotguns)+ Easy to navigate User Interface+ Many maps with 4 quickplay game modes+ Custom lobbies and party system+ In battle match game mode killstreaks seem balanced and reward objective playCONS:- TAC RELOAD!- No oceanic servers- Crouch spam- Grenade spam (stupid in tdm)- Shotguns are useless- Little customisation- In assasination game mode 'boarding' the chopper is stupid- In assasination game mode you can see the VIP through smoke- In demolition trying to disarm the bomb is fiddly- In demolition bomb timer is a bit too short imho- In demolition as a Peace Keeper (CT) you can sometimes see the bomb through walls- Jump shooting accuracy is too good- Some items don't specifically tell you what they do or how long they last for (kelvar> how much damage reduction)- Innate recoil reset- People don't realise they in observer chat when they're dead- No vote kick optionMEH:> Kill icons can be incorrect> No try before you buy> Guns must be bought permanant> Whispering to a friend while in game is fidgety> Cannot scroll through chat while in game> Clan chat OP in quickplay> No 1v1 custom TDMFINALS WORDS: This is best F2P FPS game I've played before Blacklight: Retribution went to ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• and TF2 did the Meet Your Match update. The game is fun and well balanced (for the most part) but requires some work to iron out some fiddly mechanics. You should try it.

In short: 6.5/10Pro:- If you love survival-runs this is a nice f2pCons:- Latency issues, I have no idea where servers are located but everyone has 150+ping.- Screaming kids everywhere. If you're semi-competant, you will usually ensure the survial of your team.- Little replay value.-Beware of automatic doors, they kill.- Not much variety in terms of weapons.- Never really got any heart-racing moments.Neutral: -Requires teamwork: best played with friends.- Can get the same experience and probably better if you just join a zombie map on any CS game.You might be wondering, will all these cons why I recommend the game. I had a fun time playing this for 5 hours but there are definitely better games out there. You can run this game very smoothly even with a potato.For a f2p game I honestly cannot complain too much. Codename CURE is a survival-run zombie game. You start off at a drop point and you proceed your way down to a bombsite. There's only one. You work as a team to get there and plant a bomb. You have three minutes to escape before it detonates killing everything on the map. If you die along the way, you have to wait a minute to respawn with temates that are already alive. If everyone dies it's game over (duh). In solo-play if you die with bots still alive, the game is still over. There's about 7 maps as standard. 4 difficulties: casual, easy, normal and insane. Insane is fun :)4 classes:Pointman: Auto-shotty. Good burst damage. Need to be ammo conservative. Respect the support use your frag nades wisely.Support: Gives everyone ammo. Be nice to support when asking them to deploy resupplies. Make sure the use resupply. The box can be used to block doors.Assault: Sustained damage with heavy AR. Throws frag nades. Don't worry too much about ammo, there's plenty.Sniper: Semi-auto sniper. Incendiary grenades very important to block off choke points. 2nd most important class imho. Use your nades to cover the technicians when they move their sentries. Your teammates don't et damaged by the fire but you do.Technician: Pump action-shotty. Places sentries to cover hallways. Sentry is invaluable. Protect it with your life. If it dies and you are not near the end of the game... die to respawn with one. Master the art of death. I cannot stress how important the technician and the sentry is. It wins games. Never leave the technician behind. Protect him and the sentry with your life. However, don't camp with the sentry. You always have to move up and reposition. Sentry is good defensively and offensively when pushing/holding hallways.The one time I really enjoyed this game is when I got teamed up with a guy that was willing to work in a team. With the class system every class has a crucial role but there was only 2 of us. He was sniper and I was Technician. The technician can place sentries to cover hall ways and buy time to the team to move forward. The sniper can throw incendiary nades to block off choke points and buy time for the technician to move the sentry up into a new position. Together was finished a level and that was very satisfying. Sometimes when you are in a game with 6 people you would still lose because some people undervalue a good sniper and technician who are usually behind covering the back of the team. Stick as a team and win the game. Moments like these are few and far inbetween so enjoy them.

31/08/2017Airmech Strike is a good PvP focused action RTS game that is a hybrid between games such as Starcraft with League of Legends. It runs smoothly (even on potatos) and has a very tight-nit community which keeps me coming back. It's much easier to get into compared to traditional RTS games and provides a wide range of different units and airmechs (classes/heros) to cater for your playstyle.In terms of gameplay, you pilot a mech (it's like a transformer) in which acts as your hero. You can shoot enemies with it or pick up your own to move them around. You can build various units from outposts (buildings) such as infantry, artillery and tanks which are used to battle your opponent's army. This outposts can be captured from your enimies but your ultimate goal is to destroy your opponent's base using your mech and army for a sweet victory!Fights can be intense micro wars or fast rushes which will test the skills of all players. However, battles can become stale at times sort of like trench-warefare which both teams unable to break a deadlock of tank+artillery gameplay. But with the wide range of units with different abilities avaliable you will be able to deploy different strategies which may surpise your opponent and give you an advantage.The game is free with optional microtransactions but it is not pay-2-win. Perimum currency will only get you cosmetics for your units and mechs which will not alter-gameplay. Everything in game can be earnd in time and the basic units that you are provided with in the beginning are quite solid. The business model seems very fair, heck, very generous and I feel as if you get lots of value for your money if you purchase special bundles.I live in Australia. I've played this game for 2-3 years with and without using the steam client. In that time I've only met 2 other Australian players. Everytime I played match-making PvP I have always queued up against those two same people. This game is fun when you meet the regulars and start custom lobbies but if you live in the oceanic region and don't like to talk to people, I do not recommend this game.Overall, I would recommend this game if you're looking for a casual strategy game. It's easy to get into if you've played MOBAs and RTS games. The game play is addicting but what I love most about this game is the community. I've never expereinced such a helpful community before. When I first started playing this game, many experienced players helped me transition to Airmech and have taught me almost everything I know about it! Airmech is a great game and you should give it a try :)

This game is not finished, no doubt about it. Was there ever though? TaleWorlds said time and time again, the game isn't finished and that it's early access. The negative reviews in here critisizing it for not being finished yet are cringy as ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•. No ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• sherlock.Here's an actually useful review: If you liked Mount & Blade: Warband, you WILL probably enjoy the game already in its current state. The bugs are there for sure, but I don't feel like they ruin the gameplay by any stretch. To me, the most noticeable early access thing are some minor graphical bugs here and there, performance issues and a lack of content. Mind you, it already has more content then Mount & Blade: Warband, but it is far from finished.I'm not trying to be one of those fanboys who claims the game is perfect. It is NOT FINISHED as I have said many times now. But the negative reviews in here are not fair, and as I said, cringe as ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•. If you don't like playing early access games, just wait till it is fully released you fat obnoxious fecal consumer. Love you TaleWorlds, amazing game!

This was an epic experience. I have a lot to talk about so I will dive right into it.First of all, the game looks great. Love the artstyle of Borderlands!The music is AMAZING by Jesper Kyd (Dude who did AC II's music etc, and just so happens to be my countryman).The gameplay and gunplay is way more fun then in Borderlands 2 in my opinion which is of course a great thing! As opposed to some people in here I thought the story was pretty good, but BUTSPOILER ALERT! SPOILER ALERT! SPOILER ALERT!Two things:One, Maya's death was a waste. Considering she was the siren class in Borderlands 2 and a very cool character, they killed her off way too early in the game, and the death scene was not even that great.Secondly Ava is just a straight up dislikable character. You can't change my mind.Minor complaint: Lilith I have a name, stop calling me "killer".Enough complaining, this game is great. Great music, great atmosphere, good old Borderlands humor, good gameplay, nice story. A must have in modern gaming! I would recommend it, even at full price.

I have not play this game as much as some people have, but I mean.... I can still review it, right? Right?So, first of all. I never played the first Borderlands, so this is my entrance to the franchise. The graphic style was a liiiiiittle off-putting to me initially, but as time would have it, now I find it f*cking awesome!The story is cool, with good writing and it has some very interesting characters. Borderlands 2 (as well as the franchise in general) is a game very much focused on humor in terms of dialogue and general presentation. It is a loot-based shooter RPG game, that is great to play singleplayer, but really shines through playing it coop with friends.TL;DR - Charming graphics, cool story and characters. Loot-based shooter RPG you can play with your friends.A modern gaming classic.

First of all, this game has some compatibility issues for PC (Disappearing carriages etc). You must install the software RivarTuner Statistics Server, and allow the file AC3SP to run through it (found in Steam/steamapps/common etc). Remember to set it to 60 FPS, even if your screen can handle more.The game is great! Love the setting. I for one also like Connor (badass native American assasssin). I don't get the hate for him. Sure, he's not Ezio, but he's badass.The story is pretty good, the game looks great for its age, and the combat animations are badass.All in all, I'd recommend this game. I give it 7/10, one of the better AC games.

This game is only worth playing if you're a huge fan of AC (like me). The plot is fine, and Altair is a badass character. But as a game, it is really not that enjoyable. The missions are tedious and way too similar, combat and movement mechanics are wanky... Graphically, the game looks great for its age. In short: Play it for the story, once. In my opinion, it has zero replayability. The AC franchise truly began to shine in AC II.

Total War: WARHAMMERThe Old World echoes to the clamour of ceaseless battle. The only constant is WAR!A fantasy strategy game of legendary proportions, Total War: WARHAMMER combines an addictive turn-based campaign of epic empire-building with explosive, colossal, real-time battles. All set in the vivid and incredible world of Warhammer Fantasy Battles.Command five wholly different races: Bretonnia, the Empire, the Dwarfs, the Vampire Counts and the Greenskins, each with their own unique characters, battlefield units and play style.Lead your forces to war with powerful Legendary Lords from the Warhammer Fantasy Battles World, arming them with fabled weapons, armour and deadly battle magic; hard-won in individual quest chains.For the first time in a Total War game, harness storms of magical power to aid you in battle and take to the skies with flying creatures, from ferocious dragons and wyverns to gigantic griffons.Additional Free ContentTotal War: WARHAMMER launched to critical acclaim in May 2016. Since then, a wealth of free content has been added, including the recent addition of Bretonnia as the fifth playable race in the Old World.As well as this additional race, the rich world of Total War: WARHAMMER has been expanded since release with the inclusion of four new Legendary Lords, brand new units, new Lores of Magic and over 30 bespoke maps for single and multiplayer battle. These updates are available for free to all new and existing players.Hundreds of hours of gameplay await you at the dawn of a new era. Total War: WARHAMMER brings to life a world of legendary heroes, towering monsters, flying creatures, storms of magical power and regiments of nightmarish warriors.Lead Extraordinary RacesThe Chivalrous knights of Bretonnia, the valiant men of the Empire, the vengeful Dwarfs, the murderous Vampire Counts and the brutal Orcs and Goblins of the Greenskin tribes. Each Race is wholly different with their own unique characters, campaign mechanics, battlefield units and play style.Command Legendary CharactersMarch your forces to war as one of 12 Legendary Lords from the Warhammer Fantasy Battles World, arming them with fabled weapons, armour, mounts and deadly battle magic as you uncover their tales through a series of unique narrative quest chains.Conquer this WorldThe very first Total War game to feature a fantasy setting. In the Old World Campaign, experience incredible depth and the freedom to conquer as you see fit across a gigantic sand-box map. Crafted from a twisted magical landscape and populated with an incredible array of awesome and deadly creatures, this is your chance to experience fantasy strategy on a scale as yet unimagined.Unleash the MonstersThe battlefields of Total War: WARHAMMER echo to the swoop and roar of dragons, the bellowing of giants and the thundering hooves of monstrous cavalry. Towering beasts of both earthly and supernatural origin wade into the melee of battle, bringing death to hundreds of lesser creatures at a time.Harness the Winds Of MagicSmite your enemies with magical storms, melt their armour, sap their fighting spirit or bolster your own forces with devastating spells that split the sky and consume the battlefield. Rally wizards, shamans and necromancers to your armies and bend titanic and unpredictable energies to your whim.Watch the SkiesHarass your enemies with Dwarfen Gyrocopters, plunge into their front-lines with terrifying Wyverns and achieve air superiority with a stunning array of flying units for the first time in a Total War game. Entirely new tactical possibilities present themselves as you deploy your winged minions in open battles and jaw-dropping sieges.What is more, this title will go on to combine with two future sequels and additional content packs to create the largest Total War experience ever. An epic trilogy of titles that will redefine fantasy strategy gaming.

ABOUT THIS GAMEHOW LONG WILL YOU SURVIVE?With over 14 million copies sold, 7 Days has defined the survival genre, with unrivaled crafting and world-building content. Set in a brutally unforgiving post-apocalyptic world overrun by the undead, 7 Days is an open-world game that is a unique combination of first-person shooter, survival horror, tower defense, and role-playing games. It presents combat, crafting, looting, mining, exploration, and character growth, in a way that has seen a rapturous response from fans worldwide. Play the definitive zombie survival sandbox RPG that came first. Navezgane awaits!GAME FEATURESExplore - Huge, unique and rich environments, offering the freedom to play the game any way you want, featuring 5 unique biomes and worlds up to 100 square kilometers in size.Craft ‚Ä?Handcraft and repair weapons, clothes, armor, tools, vehicles, and more with over 500 recipes. Learn more powerful recipes by finding schematics.Build ‚Ä?Design your fort to include traps, electric power, auto turrets, automated doors, gadgets and defensive positions to survive the undead in a fully destructible and moldable world.Cooperate or Compete ‚Ä?Work together to build settlements or against each other raiding other player‚Äôs bases, it‚Äôs really up to you in a wasteland where zombies and outlaws rule the land.Create ‚Ä?Unleash your creativity with access to over 800 in-game items, and over 1,300 unique building blocks and a painting system that offers infinite possibilities.Improve ‚Ä?Increase your skills with a multitude of perks under 5 main attributes. Gain additional skills by reading over 100 books. 7 Days to Die is the only true survival RPG.Choose ‚Ä?Play the campaign world, or dive back in a randomly-generated world with cities, towns, lakes, mountains, valleys, roads, caves and over 550 unique locations.Combat ‚Ä?Encounter nearly 60 unique zombie archetypes including special infected with unique behaviors and attacks progressing in difficulty to provide an infinite challenge.Survive ‚Ä?Experience real hardcore survival mechanics with nearly 50 buffs, boosts and ailments that will impact the gameplay in ways that can both challenge and aid in your survival.Destroy ‚Ä?Buildings and terrain formations can collapse under their own weight from structural damage or poor building design with real structural stability.Loot ‚Ä?Scavenge the world for the best weapons, tools, and armor with 6 quality ranges providing thousands of permutations. Augment items with a multitude of mods.Quest ‚Ä?Meet several Trader NPCs who buy and sell goods and offer quest jobs for rewards. Enjoy many unique quest types supported by over 550 locations.Customize ‚Ä?Create your own character and customize your character further in-game with a huge selection of clothing and armor you can craft or loot in the world.Drive ‚Ä?Enjoy the badass vehicle system where you find all the parts, learn the recipes, craft and customize your own bicycle, minibike, motorcycle, 4x4 or gyrocopters and ride with friends.Farm or Hunt ‚Ä?Plant and grow gardens for sustainable resources or head out into the wilderness and hunt over a dozen unique wild animals.

I truly want to say thank you to a dev who listens to even the minority voices. Having a 'game' that allows those of us who also just want to build and explore do our thing? WOW! It really opens up a title to sandbox lovers, and also harder core gamers and adventurers. I wish all open world titles took that into consideration. I love that I can just play some good tunes and build some bases, mess around and relax in the Dev world creation. I think the user customized open world sandbox is a very viable genre still! I almost never buy a game for the 'gaming' aspect of the title. It's graphics, how much I can customize, and enjoyibility factor. Thanks again to this top notch dev! Still loving The Infected!

I made a severe and continuous lapse in my judgement, and I don‚Äôt expect to be forgiven. I‚Äôm simply here to apologise.What we came across in the woods that day was obviously unplanned. The reactions you saw on tape were raw; they were unfiltered. None of us knew how to react or how to feel. I should have never posted the video. I should have put the cameras down and stopped recording what we were going through. There's a lot of things I should have done differently but I didn't. And for that, from the bottom of my heart, I am sorry. I want to apologise to the internet. I want to apologise to anyone who has seen the video. I want to apologise to anyone who has been affected or touched by mental illness, or depression, or suicide. But most importantly I want to apologise to the victim and his family. For my fans who are defending my actions, please don't. I don‚Äôt deserve to be defended. My goal with my content is always to entertain; to push the boundaries, to be all-inclusive. In the world live in, I share almost everything I do. The intent is never to be heartless, cruel, or malicious. Like I said I made a huge mistake. I don‚Äôt expect to be forgiven, I‚Äôm just here to apologise. I'm ashamed of myself. I‚Äôm disappointed in myself. And I promise to be better. I will be better. Thank you.

The Skeleton Army card is unlocked from the Bone Pit (Arena 2). It spawns 15 single-target, melee Skeletons with very low hitpoints and low damage, with an overall extremely high damage per second. A Skeleton Army card costs 3 Elixir to deploy.Due to their high numbers and overall very high DPS, the Skeleton Army is very effective against single target enemy troops and building targeting troops such as the P.E.K.K.A., Prince or Giant. Another benefit is the Skeleton Army's low cost of 3 Elixir, making it a very versatile card that can give the player an Elixir advantage in almost any case. Although they have low health individually, their sheer numbers allow for them to be effective at blocking most troops and siege buildings. This can even work for air troops, such as the Inferno Dragon due to the fact that the Skeleton Army can stall and pull the Inferno Dragon away from the tower, giving the tower a chance to destroy the Inferno Dragon. While being powerful in numbers, they are very weak against splash damage and spells; most area damage units will be able to take out the whole swarm without losing health. Low cost spells are also effective at taking the swarm out efficiently. Despite their area damage weakness, the Skeleton Army is capable of countering directional area damage troops like a Wizard or Bomber. For this to work, the Skeleton Army must be placed directly on top of the unit, surrounding it and overwhelming their area damage before the swarm is defeated. The player must also have the assistance of a Crown Tower to damage down the troop, as otherwise there is a chance the Skeletons could clump up in such a way that the troop could eliminate them all before being defeated. The Skeleton Army can bait the opponent into using their area damage spell, allowing the player to use other high DPS swarms such as Goblin Gang safely. However, unlike the Goblin Gang, the Skeleton Army can be fully countered by a wider range of spells. As such, they may not the most effective at baiting out the desired spell, such as The Log, if they have more than one. Other swarm troops such as Barbarians and Minion Horde may be more favorable as a substitute, as they have higher hitpoints compared to the Skeleton Army. However, they also have a heavier Elixir cost, which does make them more committal but also makes them more enticing for the opponent to use a higher cost spell like Fireball on them, allowing other spell-vulnerable cards in the player's deck to thrive. Poison and Fireball are a negative Elixir trade but do counter the Skeleton Army effectively. The Barbarian Barrel can not only counter the Skeleton Army for a positive Elixir trade but also force out a response from the opponent. If the barrel is played right at the river, the Barbarian that spawns will get two hits on the tower left unattended, allowing for valuable chip damage. The Skeleton Army is not recommended to be used offensively, as they can be easily wiped out with spells such as Arrows. However, if the opponent's cheap spell is out of rotation, this play may force non-efficient counters out of their hand, as if the Skeleton Army manages to lock on to a Crown Tower, they will deal extremely high damage to or even destroy it. Their high count allows them to be played in the center or behind the player's King's Tower to cover both lanes. This often entirely deters the opponent from immediately attacking, as they will only be able to spell down half of the swarm with one push. The Skeleton Army is quite effective with Clone to overwhelm your opponent when their proper counters are not in rotation. Using a Rage on the Skeleton Army makes it a huge threat since they already move quite fast and deal high damage per second. Mirroring or Cloning the Skeleton Army gives a huge numbers advantage. However, trying either of these strategies is very risky, as a splash unit or a spell can wipe it out for a positive Elixir trade. In double Elixir, the impact of failing this strategy is reduced because of the faster Elixir generation rate. An Ice Golem is able to eliminate the entire Skeleton Army with its death damage when equally leveled for a positive Elixir trade.

Yami is the best character, statistically, because she has the highest base dexterity stat and therefore the highest chance to dodge, allowing certain card combinations like the Orb of Dexterity and the Speed Module or Accelerators to be most effective. Unlike high Health or Defense stats, Dexterity can render any amount of damage null, and therefore is the the most effective stat to invest points into. Because of this, the character with the highest base Dexterity, Yami, is the best character in the game Furry ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô?developed and published by by Furry Tails and sold on Steam.

With this game I am able to pre-game for her and last for hours on end, not only this but I get 50+ levels to choose from that may or may not give me a lewd image and with that image I can go to work. This game in all honesty turned my life for the better. In the recent months I have been in a bit of a downfall but found that this game had been put on steam. It was an ancient memory of mine, that I had played this game on my grandparents computer as a child. But it was with this finding that I realized where it had all started. That sweet sweet Prego fish. It was with her that my liking of pregnant women came to light. I wish I could express to all the people my love for pregnant women. They are so beautiful and that gorgeous baby bump, it just gets me going in all the right ways. To think to myself that my first experience with the idea of pregnancy was with that fish makes my heart flutter. Even as a child I knew there was something special. In 2nd grade my teacher Mrs. Dillon became pregnant and once I realized and were able to see her baby bump I couldn't get my mind off of her. At every given chance I would hug my teacher, whether it was in the mornings or when we left at the end of the day. Something about that feeling made me jittery. I didn't understand at the time but in a few instances I thought I had wet my pants, but it was actually my young child body's way of releasing bodily fluids.

This game has honestly changed my life for the better. I use music as an escape form my daily troubles and this game was perfect. I don't know what it is but something about that Maw and how he goes di di da di di, it really makes me happy and make those noises myself. The first thing I did was make my own rendition of Somebody I used to know by Gotye, it wasn't the best but it did sound pretty good. There are endless things you can create in this game, if you can think of a song or tune, you can make it. I made the simple P-Hub intro music on an island of mine. I cannot express my love for this game and each individual monster. Though I have to suppress my sexual urges with PomPom, I still enjoy every minute. If only I could let the world know the acts PomPom and I would commit together. I dont know what it is but something about the color of her hair, the smell of her skin, how tall she is, and that sweet sweet body, its exactly what I need every day and night. But I digress, my singing monsters (MSM) is a lost gem. It was made in 2014 and was merely a mobile game on someones Ipod 5, but to me and many others its much more. As a teen, I had MSM on my phone but that was just the surface, deep in my photos were hundreds of PomPoms. It allows us to explore our own passions of music and some deeper feelings toward humanoid beings. Over all, I would recommend this to anyone looking for a new escape.

After more extensive thought, one would assume that one of the most advanced and comprehensive creations that has ever been thought up by the Human race, especially in the 21st century due to fierce competition such as popular media like ‚ÄòThe Big Bang Theory‚Ä?and ‚ÄòRick and Morty‚Ä? would be the development of the video game commonly referred to as Ark Survival Evolved which is renown for inspiring a childlike wonder in all who play. God bless Ark Survival Evolved. Similarly, there would be a hint of irony and it would be very hypocritical for oneself to ignore the fact that although such historical work like Ark Survival Evolved does have a place in all of our hearts, from its engaging characters, advanced mechanics, varying terrain and a complex ecosystem that teaches you from very early on that this isn‚Äôt a normal game. This game is designed for gamers, particularly those who practise against minorities. Ark Survival Evolved is more than a video game, it is the foundation for many strong relationships where love is cherished. This is where E-girlfriends are most common. E-girlfriends, E-girlfriends as far as the eye can see. Even the most experienced and battle tested veterans that have graced the immersive and welcoming community that resides within Ark Survival Evolved will spend days searching for the perfect E-girlfriend which has loyalty and a keen sense of respect. They even remember important dates and anniversaries such as Birthdays and they are often prone to assembling cucks from far and wide in order to appease their Boyfriends from yonder lands through parties which mostly take place at the Centre Arena on Friday nights around 8:00PM PST.

Master Duel was hyped up for the longest time with plenty of fears that it would fail to deliver, but thankfully it has met literally every expectation anyone could have imagined.The monetization system is very, VERY forgiving and - despite hefty investments on staples / handtraps - all cards are EXTREMELY accessible despite the fact that they aren't handed to you for free. Spending money is worthwhile and feels more like a bonus than a necessity and playing the game totally F2P feels very rewarding with a stable system of progression.The animations are BEAUTIFUL. Everything looks so CLEAN!!! It makes duels that you are losing bad INFINITELY MORE ENJOYABLE. Yu-Gi-Oh is super scary to new players because its hard to tell who is winning or what's happening, but solo mode very slowly and nicely introduces mechanics to new players and spectating matches is easy to follow because of the flashy animations.One issue I have is the limited soundtrack. While the soundtrack is cleverly used, there are like... 3 songs. Which kinda sucks. But it's fine.Menus also take a weirdly long time to load? Like it takes a solid 25 seconds to get from the deck editor to the ranked duel queue.If the menu animations could load faster, more songs were added, and the ability to choose between match and single format duels were in the game it would be, in my honest opinion, the perfect Yu-Gi-Oh sim.This is, without a doubt, THE way to play Yu-Gi-Oh in 2022.

We Were Here Too is a straight downgrade to We Were Here, in my opinionPuzzle games are intended to be confusing, but not frustrating. In We Were Here, there were a fair amount of points where my friend and I got confused and didn't know what to do, but the process of solving the puzzle was fun. There was a lot of trial and error and at no point were we getting mad.However, in We Were Here Too, the game was extremely indirect on how it worked. Nothing was implied, you were simply given a few resources and you just had to guess until something happened.The latter half of the game is much better. The first half is really lame and confusing, but towards the end you start to get the hang of it and the puzzles are more do-able.Still, I can't recommend buying this game at full price. I'm fine with the 5 dollars I spent, but it was like having a siphon attached to my brain that just siphoned serotonin right out for the first half hour.Final verdict? Sequels aren't always improvements.

If there's one thing that will make me not complete my dissertation on time, this game is probably it.
A meditative, calming, yet thought provoking experience. I won't say any more. If you're remotely interested in games trying to do something different, you owe it to yourself to try this one out.

I went in having seen very little of the promotional material for this game, and the hype therefore never really got to me. I expected a good open-world immersive sim, and that's exactly what I got. While the opening missions had me engaged on the narrative level, I found the gameplay in these introductory segments being like a fantasy RPG where I wanted to play a wizard but was forced to play as a fighter for the first three hours, which kind of sucked. Now that I've upped my stealth and hacking skills, I find the gameplay much more enjoyable. Looking back on those first frustrating hours, with no real way around the gunfights and with enemies taking a considerable amount of fire to bring down, I realize that this is probably a major factor in my enjoyment of the game a dozen or so hours in, as it really lets me appreciate how far my character has evolved his combat skills. It's not a perfect game - the devs overpromised and underdelivered, and the technical issues are a matter of concern, especially on the old consoles - but so far I'm thoroughly enjoying myself. I'm really excited to see where CDPR will be taking this game over the next few yers.

All good stories must come to an endUnless things change, games like this will only be a shell of "what could have been"Battlefield fells less like a game and more like a show, meaning that the more seasons a show has the staler it becomesFlashy trailers, high expectations across the globe, one more year of development and promised features that never came to be, all of this culminated to a terrible launch and a terrible product in general.Things like this are supposed to be a "standard" these days and the more we indulge, the worst will getWhy did i buy the game then? Like a lot of people in the community, I wanted this game to be great, which only makes it worse when you find that the lied to youWhat i think about the game:The game has around 70 to 80 hours of content, this includes having experienced all the modes, tried every single gun, tried every single vehicle, saw every single map and unlocked some banners or badges. What you do after that is all up to you, but what most people will do is wait until the first season...  Good luck with thatIf you didn't get the memo, leaked info about the game showed that the first season should come out in March... Keep in mind that this is a game that is discarded every two years.I wouldn't get my hopes up, especially since a lot changes have been happening inside DICERegarding gameplay, i can't believe how bad it became, especially after Battlefield V, that game had a lot of problems but gameplay wasn't one of them. Not just that but bugs, lots of bugsThe idea of changing attachments on the fly is great, but it was poorly implemented.The worst offenders are the tornado and the "massive destruction". The tornado is basically a show piece which barely works and it is just used to get altitude. And to top it all of, the "massive destruction" is a feature that can only be described as "antenna go boing" and "metal sheet drop"I didn't even include the massive missile exploding since people seem to have forgotten about it tooNow for a quick round:There are only two main game modes, hazard zone is empty, hazard zone has no support and no special maps, the outcome of matches doesn‚Äôt affect the story of the game, no single player, portal gives no xp, portal mostly doesn't have permanent game modes, clunky menus, terrible frame rate and this are just some that annoy me. For more just search the Battlefield 2042 subredditVerdict:Just stick with Battlefield VSimple and actually cheap

The Outer Wilds is a weird game for me.I have tried to play through this game 3 times already and only recently i actually got to finish itAnd what is me veridict... Wow it is beautiful and tiring at the same time. Let me explainLet's start with the bad stuff, the respawn system.I loved the lore behind the statues and why we are stuck on a loop, it is beautiful and full of stuff to read but the process itself is really boring. Everytime you respawn/die you watch the memories of the loop you just experienced, even though this is cool and in sync with the lore, by the 20th time you see it, it isn't fun anymoreIn this game dying is really present, not just because every 22 minutes the sun explodes but because you can die in some pretty stupid ways, so why can't i just skip that little cutseen?Another problem with the game is how some of the deaths can feel unfair or even out of your control, for example, running out of gas and oxygen.Once your gas runs out you start using oxygen for your "jetpack". The problem start when you can't control exactly when it activates and this makes very hard to not use oxygen, and if it runs out you dieWith the bad stuff out of the way let's get into the good stuff!Details, they are everywhere and they are important too! I love games like this that take time to explain "everything" so you can understand the world better.The devs didn't had to include half of the stuff they did, but if they didn't the experience would be worse. One of the details i loved was related to the respawn system. The thing that amazed me was how the main character wakes up differently after every loop, depending on how you died or how you ended the loopIf theres a difference on how you wake up, i can't imagine how many details and little stories are out there among the stars and other planets.Speaking of other planets, every planet in the solar system feels completly different, giving a lot of variety and challenges every time you visit a new planetThings like the map, the ship,the characters, the athmosphere and the music all make this game feel alive, and this is the best compliment i can give! The world seems full and has a long story to tellIf you have pacience and you enjoy a really good story, then maybe this game is for you. Like me you may have some problems getting used to the respawn system and other stuff that turns the game a little slow and tiring but after you adjust you start to enjoy the game for what it is9/10

ABZU is a beautifuly crafted world with a simple but ellagant story.If i had to say something memorable about this game it would be the music. Austin Wintory, the same composer behind Journey and The Pathless did an amazing job showing emotion and atmosphere through sound, places feel more alive then ever.Talking about "places being alive" the game is full of fish and other sea life, some that i didn't even knew existed.Games that have some "water level" usually are seen as doomed from the start, just because it is really hard to get it to feel smooth to play but let me tell you, they got it right!It isn't perfect but it does the job well, but in this case i have complaines about the other section of the game, the walking section. It feels slow and unecessary, the good thing is that i doesn't last long If i had to rate this game i would definetly give it a 8.5/10Like i said it isn't perfect but it was able to stay on my head for some time

Good Game !!Shakes & Fidget is a MMORPG game Free Flash to browsers. Developed by Oskar Pannier & Marvin Clifford for web browsers. Based on the legendary comic book, create your own heroes, and get into a dangerous world inhabited by satanic monsters rabbits and girlfriends. Take on exciting adventures or disarm his companions in the sand! Gain experience, get gold, honors and sleeve requires your own guild with your friends. No need to download or install any software. You can play for free and do not contain advertising.Visit the tavern, the first stop of the adventurer and aspiring. You can find people willing to trust different tasks, allowing you to earn money and experience. If you click on the person sitting on the table in front, you will see three task and choose one of them. Or, alternatively, you can visit the sand where their skills compared to other heroes and heroines, and win (or lose) gold and honor. The system automatically chooses a rival that is about the same number of honor points you.The continuous development of "Shakes & Fidget - The Game", its technical server costs and are covered by the model of "free play." You can purchase additional bristles in the game to help make faster progress. For example, you can negotiate with mushrooms to increase your daily limit of missions. Mushrooms are an additional currency which can help you to progress faster in the game.Thanks PlayaGames !

How its expected from an PS exclusive, this game is just amazing but as someone that is an PC guy there are a few things you should know:To start right to the bad points, this game is heavy if you have an low/mid end PC also, if you wanna stream it at atleast 1080p you are going to need an high end PC, no doubts. This game uses a lot of Ram, CPU and GPU all at once.Besides that, this PC version, from the small time i've played it, has some audio erros that could be an problem with windows, if you have an low/mid end PC and you lag into the game, the voices desyncronize with the characters, which makes it really annoying and you'll need to restart the game.So far, these are the only bad points that i can afford to tell you, anything but that, the game just feels, looks and really is incredible!

So, About smite. Gotta say, played it on beta and it actually improved a lot !Things beta had :- Limited Cancodemon Skin + icon and beta tester icon.- Dominion game that actually i loved alot to play.- 1 server for all regions, you could actually play with people over the world without change anything.- Good optimation for the year it was made.Things new Smite has:- Its been more and more a game related to league of legends, you just pay to skins and you can get them much easier but i think the 7D chests rotation should be smaller.- You cannot gift friends, That sucks :c- You CANNOT, literally, say a bad word that if you get 1 game reported you're banned.- You have even better graphics and a better optimation.- Inovated skins but gods seem alot like league champs.- weekly Updates (sometimes there are alot of updates over the week)So, i recommend this game. It will seem weird at start but its good, play it for 10 hours and you'll start enjoying it. Beying a noob its always the easiest excuse to stop playing, but have you ever tryied to stop be one of the worse? What are you waiting? Join us on this game and let's find the Pro Player in yourself !

In a world where evil takes place two partners will take on the world together as a sword and shield and will wage war on the enemy that threatens to destroy the world they live in will they be able to stop them in time?This game is a different type of game from the brand "Resident Evil" it involves a lot more action and teamwork unlike any other resident evil game out there, this game isn¬¥t scary at all and its a lot of fun to play, you can also grab a friend to start an adventure together in co-op mode with will be even more fun to play but the game itself is fun to play even playing solo.You can even teammate with random players from online mode and you may start playing with an unknown player in the finale of the game that player will become your greatest ally after the game is complete.It¬¥s a great fun experience to play this game i used to play this alot way back when it first  came out for the PlayStation 3 and i used to help alot of new players in the game because i was completly addicted to it and i loved to help the players have a great experience.(My Opinion)This Game is the Best Resident Evil out there so far because you can actually grab friends and play together and play online against other people and have a fight to the "Death" with alot of different characters. Basicly if you like co-op action games you cannot i mean CANNOT miss out a chance to grab this 1 because this is seriusly one of the best around.  Review: 10/10 - Really Addicting GameStory: 10/10 - Really Fun and EntertainingWeapons: A Bunch of different onesVersus: It always fun to play against each other and team-up with a friend to bring another team down.DLCs: Both DLCs are great but they can be a bit hard if you are not that experienced on the game.I reccomend buying Resident Evil Gold Edition because it already brings costumes to change the appearence of your character and it even brings the DLCs of the game.
Fun game

Resident evil Revelations is one of My favorite Horror games of "Survival Horror", being a huge resident evil fan i have to review this game.The game makes you feel like your in a Nightmare where you have to Fight Your Fears, against "Monsters" your deep fears "Every path you take is a challenge where you will find alot of dangerous hidden beyond the ship, and you will never know when its about to happend until it actually does, this game has alot of suspense and pressure if you make a wrong move your a goner, can you survive the dangerous paths you take?Then What are you waiting for?You will not regret buying it.10/10 Game

A Great Competitive Game to have fun with friends or play competitive.Interesting Game because you have alot of Gods of different Mythology and some gods have advantages on others because of their Mythology and origins which is really interesting in a game comparing to League of Legends i think this game is way more fun to play.I highly recommend it, if you want a great competitive and a really fun  game this 1 will entertain you alot.Explaining the concept of Gods having advantages on others.Each God has his differents habilities and strenght  his purpose in the game his role some gods can be stronger oppenents to others meaning his "Mythology" is greater then another god example He Bo is a god that controls massive and turbulent waters, also theres Poseidon the Greek god that also has habilities on water although did you know that Poseidon may be a god on "SMITE" but in his real lore you can search it if you want "OFC" Poseidon is considered a Semi-God, and He-Bo is definetly stronger than Poseidon in the game due to his massive bursting damage through out the Game, thats what i was trying to explain, although they might have certain advantages on others like im trying to say i mean bellona definetly has advantages on others due to her absorb and her abusive "KIT" i think you all got the point now, although despite minor advantages, a few kills on a GOD can make it  very OP and abusive through out the game so its the concept of having minor advantages on others is through there habilites and kits in the game but like i said despite minor advantages in game, each god can get a few kills and be a force to be dealt with in-game.Although its a minor concept about certain advantages with the gods it all depends on your team composition against the other gods, it will depend on your builds and how much you farm.Dont get greedy and think that picking Gods like He-bo, Scylla you will automatically win against other gods, no thats not the point here it will all depend on how you perform in the game.

First to start off, you need to get this game right ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô?now. Special edition if you want additional content for Payday 2. This game has a lot of major improvements from the first game. It has better AI movement and predictions, more choices of killing mobsters with, and a more detailed storyline. The difficulty remains the same but they introduced hard mode so it gives Hotline Miami fans a challenge in completing it along with the normal mode. The mask you choose depends on your playstyle. It's crucial in understanding each mask's charcteristics before you start a chapter. Would recommend to anyone interested in indie games and the first Hotline Miami. 10/10

Okay I just wanna say that this game is a good game, and if you wanna know why its good go read other reviews, as they do a better presentation than I do. All I wanna throw out there for people who seek to buy this game is that the Creation Hub is not a big deal. People keep complaining about how money grabbing it is and how it ruin the game. But they forgot that the Creation Hub are optional, you don't like it then don't buy the CH mods. You don't have to support it, its not like Creation Hub is a game breaking thing that hinder the player's progression. Its there is you want it and if you don't just  ignore it. They are not forcing you to have to use CH. If you want good quality mods just go to Nexus. Stop trying to make this a big deal when its only presence is in the Menu.PS:I don't support Creation Hub so calling me a shill won't justify anything.

Tangle Tower is a phenomenal point-and-click game that has excellent storytelling which gives you outstanding gameplay.Graphics are very nice to look at, and all the sounds - including music or conversations between you and others - are amazing. Searching for clues, interrogating suspects, and reaching conclusions are extremely interesting here.While playing the game you can feel like an actual detective solving a crime.Despite the fact that you can finish the game in one sitting it's definitely worth trying. For me, it is10/10.PS. I hope that SFB Games will release other games like this one.
